loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 44 years old, married and a father of three children. 

For the last 14 years, he has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. 

John was introduced to KADET Ltd. by our credit officer, and he is applying for his third loan of KES 60,000, to buy seeds, some fertilizer and other farm inputs needed for his business. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children as well as to expand his farming activities. His goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming with a view of increasing his income so as to improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase farming inputs like seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth materials.

loans.name: Mwanauba

texts.en:
Mwanauba is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past five years, she has operated a business of selling leso (women's wrap) cloth. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. She dreams of expanding to become a big supplier of clothes in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase 40 pieces of leso for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 40 pieces of leso for resale.

loans.name: Sasini

texts.en:
Sasini is 30 years old and supporting a family of five members. He has been farming for 10 years with a monthly income of 80,000 KES.

Sasini is requesting his fourth loan from KADET LTD for 60,000 KES, which he will use to purchase more livestock and other farm inputs. With the anticipated profit, he will expand his business and earn a bigger profit.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and other farm inputs

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married and has three school-going children. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a poultry-selling business. She sells to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenges are the high cost of transportation to her place of operation and diseases affecting her poultry.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase chicks, chicken feeds and vaccine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, chicken feeds and vaccine.

loans.name: Rubymae

texts.en:
Rubymae is in her third year of study at Misamis University, Ozamiz City, for her BS in medtech. 

Her mother is a government employee and her father is earning from his pension. She joined Gata Daku MPC and borrowed a loan of 14,000 PHP to cover the costs of school tuition fees for her first semester. 

In the future, she wants to finish her study, get a job related to her course, and be able to help her parents.

loans.use: to cover the costs of school tuition fees for her first semester.

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar invirtiendo en su negocio; este le permitirá comprar variedad de ropa, tales como: blusas, faldas, vestidos y ropa interior para damas.
El crédito anterior le ayudo a satisfacer las necesidades de los clientes y obtuvo mayores ingresos pero las circunstancias familiares se mantienen igual.
texts.en:
Ana needs to request a new loan now that she requires more working capital to invest in her business. She will buy assorted clothes, such as blouses, skirts, dresses and women underwear.

The previous loan helped her to fulfill her customers’ needs and receive a higher income. The conditions at home remain the same.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, dresses and women underwear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

Fatuma makes snacks such as samosas. She uses green grams (mung beans) to make her samosas and sells them to passersby and neighbors.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase additional food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, and green grams. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, and green grams (mung beans).

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 26 years old and supports a seven-year-old child. For the past year she has been selling shoes. Lilian earns 14,000 KES each month.

Lilian is requesting a 10,000 KES loan from KADET LTD to purchase shoes to sell. This is her first loan. She plans to use the anticipated profit from her loan to expand her business. In the future, Lilian dreams of having a successful business.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cooking oil, rice, tomatoes, etc., wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Kantati * 26 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento KANTATI * 26,  Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes cinco mujeres y tres varones,   la presidenta del banco la  Sra. Lucila tiene 56 años, tiene  dos hijos ya mayores de edad la  Sra. Lucila se dedica a la venta de variedad de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, y variedad de artículos en su tienda de barrio,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la  Sra. Lucila va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de abarrotes para surtir su negocio como arroz, fideo, harina y azúcar por mayor y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, la  Sra. Lucila va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, la  Sra. Lucila es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella y a sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en: The Entrepreneurship Bank KANTATI * 26 is composed of eight members: five women and three men. The bank president Lucila is 56 years old and has two adult children. Lucila sells a variety of essential items such as groceries and various other items in her neighbourhood store. This loan is their first within the institution. Lucila will use this loan to purchase variety of groceries to stock her business, such as wholesale rice, noodles, flour and sugar and thus provide variety of products to their customers. Their reason for applying for this loan is to keep improving their business. Lucila will use the profits to continue purchasing products, thereby improving their income. Lucila is a very hardworking person, and feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support given to her and her team members.

loans.use: to purchase wholesale groceries

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who says that she has been able to greatly increase her income and improve her living standards, thanks to her hard work.

She is asking for a loan to buy more fish for resale. She is grateful for the new support she has received that will boost her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Kodjo

texts.fr: Pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille, Mr Kodzo a démarré depuis 2012 la vente des produits d'alimentation générale. Âgé de 31ans, il est marié et père d'un enfant de 02ans. Son second crédit lui permettra d'acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les besoins des clients.
texts.en:
Mr. Kodjo, age 31, is the married father of a 2-year-old child. To support his family, he started to sell general food products in 2012. 

This second loan will help him to bolster his stock of merchandise and meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy general food products for resale.

loans.name: Aisuluu

texts.ru: Айсулуу 63 года, вдова, после смерти мужа сама воспитывает троих детей, а также ведет свое хозяйство. У Айсулуу - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Айсулуу занимается животноводством, стартовав 6 лет назад, с покупки скота на 40,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Айсулуу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 7 дойных коров, 25 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 20,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айсулуу обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Айсулуу планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en:
Aisuluu is a 63-year-old widow. After the death of her husband, she was left to raise three children on her own, and similarly to run their farm. Aisuluu has a high school education. As the main source of income for her family, Aisuluu is involved in raising livestock, starting six years ago with the purchase of livestock for 40,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Aisuluu now has on her farm: seven dairy cows and 25 sheep. The monthly income is 20,000 som (KGS). 

With the aim of further developing her farm, Aisuluu turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 125,000 som (KGS) to buy cows to increase the count of livestock. 

Aisuluu plans to invest income from the loan to further augment the quantity of domestic animals.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Aqeed

texts.en:
Aqeed is a 27-year-old single man who lives in Taiz, Yemen. He is very hardworking and does his best to improve his living. Aqeed studied at the university level. He works selling phone accessories to earn a low salary which is hardly enough to pay rent on a small house. Aqeed never depends on anyone and always does as much he can to earn money for his daily expenses.

Aqeed is requesting a 300,000 YER youth loan to buy some furniture for his house. In the future, he hopes to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his house

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.en:
This is Rodolfo. His previous loan was a big help in his business and he was able to buy more products for his rolling store. Rodolfo’s loan is also helping with the education of his children and to cover his everyday home expenses. 

Rodolfo is requesting another 30,000 PHP to pay for additional products such as toys and household products like pails, basins, dippers, and other products needed for his rolling store. More items to sell will result in better profit which will definitely help him to sustain his daily needs and provide for educational expenses of his children. Rodolfo looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. In the future, he hopes to have another rolling store and to have employees and he dreams of giving his children a good and quality education. Rodolfo meets up weekly with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his life and business and draw strength and inspiration studying the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy toys and household products such as pails, basins, and dippers for his rolling store

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a hardworking and enterprising woman. For the past two years, she has operated a general store where she sells to her neighbors and passersby. Mishi owns a house with electricity and running water. Her major business challenges are seasonality and theft. Mishi decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Mishi is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase maize flour, soap, cooking oil, rice, beans and other items. In the future, she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, soap, cooking oil, rice, beans and other items

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi appreciates her previous loan, which improved her living standards and enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She would like to apply for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings to buy more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and green peas. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of wheat flour, cooking oil and green peas

loans.name: Lira

texts.ru: Лира 43 года, разведена, имеет 2 детей. У Лиры средне-специальное образование, имеет очень хорошие отзывы от своих соседей. Они отзываются о ней как о доброй и трудолюбивой женщине. Лира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2008 года занимается торговлей продуктов питания, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 сом KGS. Магазин у нее собственный, реализует продукты питания. Благодаря упорному труду Лиры, она смогла развить и расширить свой товар, ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Лире расширить свой товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Лира обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 83,000 сом (KGS) на покупку оптовых продуктов питания для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита помогут Лире увеличить товарооборот в продуктовом магазине, а также полученная прибыль поможет растить и обучить детей в хороших условиях.
texts.en:
Lira is 43 years old, divorced, and has two children. Lira has a specialized high school education. She has very good reviews from her neighbors. They speak of her as a kind and hardworking woman. As the main source of income for the family, Lira has since 2008 been involved in trade of food products, having started this business with 20,000 som (KGS). She has her own shop where she sells food products. Thanks to her hard work, Lira was able to develop and grow her business. Her activities bring in about 15,000 som KGS per month, which is the basis for food and household expenses. Income from the business allowed Lira to expand her inventory. 

With the aim of further developing her business, Lira turned to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 83,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of wholesale food products for resale. Income from the loan will help Lira to increase trade in the grocery store, and the resulting profit will help to raise and educate the children in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid lives in the Kongowea area in Kenya. He is 38 years old, a married man, and a father of four children. He has been running a retail business for the last seven years that has been feeding him and his family. 

He knew of Milango through friends, and now he seeks a loan to buy sugar, flour and salt for the business. He has a vision of opening a wholesale business in the next five years. The major challenges in the business are competition and funding. The extra income that he will raise from this loan will pay school fees for his children and provide good health for the whole family.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour and salt.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman, with one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental house that has piped water and electricity. 

Elizabeth has operated a beauty salon business for the past two years. Her potential customers are local women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the KSH 30,000 she wants to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oil, shampoos, and hair conditioners.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en: Mwanasiti appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards.  With that loan she managed to add more stock of consumables and was able to prepare a lot of food and attract more customers. She is now requesting a loan of 100,000 KES to purchase rice, tea leaves, bread, cooking oil, salt and sugar. Her previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase tea leaves, bread, cooking oil, salt and sugar

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 30 years old and single with two children who are 12 and 14. Her children are still in school and they live at home. Josephine lives in New Kru Town. For the past four years, she has been operating a small shop where she sells clothespins. Josephine says that sometimes business is slow, but most of the time she realize some profit. She started her business selling small goods she could afford door-to-door in different communities. Josephine learned this way of selling from her friends.

Josephine is requesting a loan to purchase more clothespins for her business. Her plan is to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothespins for her business

loans.name: Lucy's Group

texts.en:
Lucy is one of the members of this group. The group is comprised of three micro-entrepreneurs from Dansoman-Accra, Ghana. 

Lucy is single and has one child, who is 18 years old and a second-cycle student. 

Lucy is very excited to be receiving her first loan from ID-Ghana, hopeful of repaying it successfully. She has had her business for around ten years. Her business consists of selling foodstuffs (cassavas, plantains, coco-yams, yams, etc.)

With this loan, Lucy will be able to buy more plantains, cassavas, coco-yams, and yams to sell to customers in Dansoman.  By buying in bulk, she will be able to reduce the prices she pays, giving her a competitive advantage in her bustling market.

Lucy has big dreams for the future of her family. She hopes that, one day, she will be able to buy a plot of land of her own, for her family.  She thanks you all for your support!

loans.use: To buy more plantains, cassavas, coco-yams, and yams to sell to customers

loans.name: Marie Noel

texts.fr: Marie Noel est une femme de 38 ans mariée mère de 1 enfant, elle a aussi 02 personnes à sa charge. Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais(safouS, plantain....) en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis des années. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock de vivres frais ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Marie Noel, age 38, is married with one child, and she has two dependents in her care. She has been selling fresh seasonal produce such as safous (an African pear), plantains, etc. at a local market for many years. She knows the suppliers well, and she is quite familiar with the clientele she built over time thanks to her experience in this activity.  

She regularly faces stock shortages. This is due to the fact that her capital is limited, which forces her to sell all her stock before she can afford to replenish it. She would like to stock up on fresh produce to better meet customer demand and avoid further stock shortages. She will save her profits to expand her activity and to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to stock up on fresh produce.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is a 40 year-old woman. She lives in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia. 

Nona owns a shop, where she sells mobile phones and accessories. She has a need for money to purchase more mobile phones and has been applying for credit among local financial institutions.  Her attempts have been unsuccessful though due to her poor living conditions. This start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables both poor rural and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $1300. 

With the received credit she will purchase new mobile phones and accessories and will be able to offer her clients a wider assortment of products. This enhanced assortment will increase her sales and her income.  With increased income, she will be able to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of mobile phones and accessories for her shop

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child who attends school. In 2007, after nine years of experience working in the plumbing business, Ali decided to work on his own serving customers wherever they are located. He is very good at his job and always leaves his customers satisfied.  

Ali is requesting a youth loan from the Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay his child’s school fees. The new school year is about to begin and he wants to pay his child’s educational fees so he can tranquilly pursue his education. Ali hopes that his business will grow with the coming years and he dreams that all of his hard work will allow him to provide his child with a good future and high educational level.

loans.use: to pay his child’s educational fees

loans.name: Do It Well Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Do It Well” group. They are small scale businesswomen based in Waterloo, near Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Ejatu. Ejatu is 42; she was born in Yarms-Farm, on the outskirts of Freetown. Her husband is a contractor and her child is attending secondary school. For five years now, Ejatu has been selling charcoal. With this loan, she will buy a large quantity of charcoal to add to her current stock to sell.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of charcoal to add to her current stock

loans.name: Double Portion Group

texts.en:
Mariama was born in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone, 36 years ago. She is married to a businessman and the couple has four children who are attending primary and secondary school. For the past 17 years, Mariama has been selling soft drinks, plastic containers of water, mayonnaise, sugar, rum, and other items. She is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. 
 
Mariama and her group members are requesting their first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders to expand their respective businesses, make more sales, and improve their living conditions. Mariama will use her 500,000 SLL share of the loan to buy soft drinks, plastic containers of water, mayonnaise, sugar, rum, and other items wholesale to sell.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, water, mayonnaise, sugar, rum, and other items

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 54 años de edad, vive en su casa propia junto a sus hijos. Su principal actividad es el comercio, se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles siendo su casa su propio centro de trabajo. Hace 5 años que se divorcio de su esposo y así decidió emprender una nueva vida a lado de sus hijos, al principio le afecto la situación, siendo su esposo el que solventaba los gastos, pero a raíz de su separación tuvo que buscar una manera de generar sola sus ingresos, es así que decide poner un negocio y gracias al apoyo de sus padres pudo afrontar su problema y salir adelante para mejorar su calidad de vida y el de su familia.
Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para implementar su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.600 soles el cual lo invertirá en la compra de productos comestibles como arroz, conservas enlatadas, leche, entre otros.
texts.en:
María is fifty-four years old and lives in a house that she owns, together with her children.  Her main activity is business, and she makes a living selling food products.  Her house has also become her own center of work.

Five years ago, she divorced her husband and decided to begin a new life alongside her children.  At first, she was very troubled by her situation.  Her husband always took care of the expenses, but as a result of their separation, she had to search for a way to make her own income.  She decided to set up a business.  Thanks to the support of her parents, she was able to confront this problem and move forward in order to improve the quality of life for herself and her family.

This is her first loan with Kiva.  She is very grateful for the opportunity to obtain financing, which will be very useful in implementing her business.  She is requesting a loan for 600 soles.  She will invest in the purchase of food products, like rice, canned items, milk, and others.


Esta es su primer crédito con Kiva, y esta muy agradecida por la oportunidad que se le presenta para obtener una línea de financiamiento el cual le será muy útil para implementar su negocio. En esta oportunidad solicitara S/.600 soles el cual lo invertirá en la compra de productos comestibles como arroz, conservas enlatadas, leche, entre otros.

loans.use: to buy food products, like rice, canned items, milk, and others.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
Binti appreciates her previous Kiva loan that improved her living standards. She renovated her stall using the loan and thereby attracted more customers. 

Binti is requesting a new loan of ksh.100,000 to purchase rice, onions, beans, wheat flour and potatoes. She thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase rice, onions, beans, wheat flour and potatoes

loans.name: Ramlah

texts.en:
Ramlah is a married woman, with one child who goes to school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling as retail to her neighbours and passersby. With the loan, she wants to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her business.

She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of charcoal in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy, a married mother of two school-going children, lives with her family in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rental bills and school fees.


Lucy has operated a fruit and vegetable stall for the past five years, selling  from home to her neighbors.  Having decided to join Yehu to get financial support, she has requested this Kshs 20,000 loan to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale. She dreams of establishing a mini green grocer in the future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of green vegetables, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Godffray

texts.en:
Godffray is 29 years old and newly married. His wife brings home an additional income from the sale of fruits and vegetables in a nearby market. He supports a family of four that includes his brother and a cousin.

Goddfray has operated a motorcycle transport business for the last 3 years in Narok town that earns him approximately 12,000 KES in a month. He learned about KADET from his fellow riders who are already registered members of KADET Ltd. He has acquired a first loan of 77,000 KES which will assist him in purchasing an additional motorcycle so he can involve his brother in the transport business.

The additional proceeds will be used to take care of the family's basic needs. His hope is to be successful in life.

loans.use: buy an additional motorcycle

loans.name: Kyabugimbi Abamwe Traders Group

texts.en:
Amina is one of the members of Kyabugimbi Abamwe Traders Group. She has been in the group for two years and has borrowed twice, through the same group. She is married, and she has six children and one other dependant. All the six children go to school, and she believes they will have quality education. Her major source of income is agricultural produce trading, which she has done for the last two years. In addition to the produce business, she also sells second-hand clothes, which gives her additional income. She works six days in a week and she gives the business an average of seven hours per day. Her business is located in a busy trading centre.

Amina plans to use her part of the loan money, UGX700,000 (Seven hundred thousand shillings), to buy more produce for sale. Her customers are both males and females from the same locality, who trade produce. Her main challenge is the weather, which changes and sometimes causes her shortages. She describes herself as a hard-working person who has hopes of developing, especially if the loan is given to her.

loans.use: To buy agricultural produce to resell

loans.name: Vctoria

texts.en:
Vctoria lives and works in St. Paul. St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for their fish due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb located just outside Monrovia, past the Free-port. It is one of the poorer areas and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing.
 
Vctoria is 36 years old and is single with four children, ages between 3 months old and 13 years old; only three of them are in school and they all live at home. For the past 6 years Vctoria has been operating a small table market where she sells bitter ball, pepper, onion, vita and many items. She started this business by selling plantains in her community with the little goods she could afford. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She is requesting a loan to purchase more bitter ball, pepper, onion, vita and many items for her business. Her plan is to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more bitter ball, pepper, onion, vita and many items for her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fish, different types of shrimp, and other products.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hasan is a 46-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three children, all of whom attend school. Since 1995, he has worked as a talented home painter. Hasan also operates a painting shop where he sells paintings and related accessories. 

Hasan is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay his children’s educational fees. He is aiming to avoid financial issues with the school management. In the future, Hasan is planning to work at one more job to earn additional income and enhance his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to pay his children’s educational fees

loans.name: Ruth Taylor

texts.en:
A single mother with one child, Ruth Taylor operates a plantain and fruit retail business in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She is the sole breadwinner in the family.


Ruth Taylor will use this loan to purchase increased amounts of plantain and fruits in order to improve her overall sales. As a junior high school graduate, she understands the importance of education in improving social conditions, so she plans to use the profits from her expanded enterprise to ensure that her child remains in school.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of plantain and fruits, thus helping her to improve her overall sales.

loans.name: Loise

texts.en:
Loise is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rental bills, and school fees. 

For the past three years she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned seasonality and theft as her major challenges. 

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, and cooking  oil

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Esi is an entrepreneur. She specializes in preparing and selling ‘Wakye’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made primarily from beans, rice and colored leaves). She usually sells her ‘Wakye’ in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in preparing and selling ‘Wakye’ for 2 years. Esi is married and has 3 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Esi wants to use her loan to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels. As a result, this will allow her to sell greater quantities of her tasty ‘Wakye’. In the long term, Esi plans to reinvest the future profits back into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to purchase a greater quantity of rice and beans, thus increasing her current inventory levels.

loans.name: Marat

texts.en:
Marat is from Kapan town where he lives with his wife and two little children. For the past six months, he has been earning his living by providing car washing service to locals. Marat has been able to earn a sustainable income for his family during this time. He has previously requested loans from local financial institutions several times without any success. Marat’s requests are rejected because his business isn't formally registered. 

Marat is requesting a loan to purchase a car-washing machine to continue his local business. His request has been approved within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. This loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit. His loan is very important for Marat and will greatly assist him to make his work more effective. Marat awaits lender support.

loans.use: to pay for a car washing machine

loans.name: Aggrey Kihara

texts.en:
Aggrey lives in central Kenya with his family of five. He is a farmer, and this is his main source of income. He has two acres of land on which he has planted tea, with only a small portion left for his homestead where he also has keeps ten zero-grazed cows, five pigs, and a number of chicken. 

Since his wife is a stay-at-home mum, Aggrey is the sole bread-winner and his money goes to all the family expenses and for children’s school fees.
Aggrey has to buy firewood and LPG gas for cooking because his wife is not in a position to handle heavy tasks due to her health conditions, and the children are all in school so they do not have time to collect firewood. This is very expensive for Aggrey.

With ten cows and five pigs, Aggrey can use a 12 m3 bio-digester to supply him and his family all the fuel they need for cooking, heating, and lighting.
With the help of a credit from VEP, he has a bio-digester under construction. Aggrey's greatest joy is that his ailing wife will have the convenience of using cleaner, safer fuel and not have to suffer any more from a smoky kitchen.  Aggrey will not also have to buy firewood and LPG gas, and with this money he will be able to repay the loan.

The bio-slurry will also save him from buying fertilizer while still improving his crop production, especially fodder, and that will be an added advantage. Well fed livestock will add milk production and increase his income. The benefits with the biogas will give him a chain of advantages, improving his livelihood in the end.

loans.use: To construct a bio-digester

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул 46 лет, разведена, имеет 2 детей. У Нургул средне-специальное образование. Нургул в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2010 года занимается торговлей косметики, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Нургул, она смогла развить и расширить свой товар, ее деятельность приносит около 10,000 сом KGS в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Нургул расширить свой товарооборот. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нургул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS) на покупку косметики для дальнейшей перепродажи. Доходы от кредита помогут Нургул увеличить товарооборот, а также полученная прибыль поможет растить и обучить детей в хороших условиях.
texts.en:
Nurgul is 46 years old, divorced, and has two children. Nurgul has a specialized high school education. As the main source of income for her family, Nurgul has been involved since 2010 in selling cosmetics, having started this business with 10,000 som KGS. Thanks to her hard work, Nurgul was able to develop and grow her trade. Her activities bring in about 10,000 som KGS monthly, which provide the basis for food and household expenses for the family. Profits from the business allowed Nurgul to expand her inventory. 

With the aim of further developing her business, Nurgul appealed to the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan of 10,000 som (KGS) to buy cosmetics for subsequent resale.

Income from the loan will help Nurgul to expand her inventory, and similarly the resulting profit will help to raise and educate her children in good conditions.

loans.use: to conduct cosmetics sales

loans.name: Eldorjon

texts.ru: Элдорчон добросовестный, честный,  целеустремленный и трудолюбивый человек. Он родился  сельской  местности.   Он ещё  не женат. Его семья занята выращиванием сельхоз  культур и  животноводством. Его брат в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Он  намерен  использовать займ для оплаты  учёбы брата.  Он хочет, чтобы его брат был высококвалифицированным специалистом. Элдорчон очень любит своего брата. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Eldorjon is a conscientious, honest, dedicated and hardworking person. He was born in a rural area. He is not yet married. His family is involved in the cultivation of crops and livestock. 

This year his brother graduated from high school and enrolled in a university. He intends to use a loan to pay tuition for his brother. He wants his brother to become a highly qualified specialist. Eldorjon love his brother very much. 

He is asking for a loan of 6,000 somoni.

loans.use: to pay tuition for his brother

loans.name: Leonora

texts.es: Leonora tiene 36 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad de Patria junto con su pareja y sus dos hijos, ella es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que sale adelante con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación pues  su actividad económica principal es la venta de yuca. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Señor de Huanca de Patria” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como yucas y así aumentar su capital de trabajo en este rubro. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales con mucha responsabilidad. (El poblado de Patria se destaca por el comercio de productos de la selva, así como servicios de alojamiento y restaurantes. Punto de ingreso al Parque Nacional del Manu.)
texts.en: Leonora is 36 years old and lives in the beautiful town of Patria together with her partner and their two children. She is a hardworking entrepreneur who is working to get ahead through hard work and dedication. Her main economic activity is the sale of cassava. She has already spent several years dedicated to this business and it is doing very well thanks to the effort she puts in. She belongs to the community bank "Señor de Huanca de Patria" and she needs a loan in order to buy more merchandise such as cassava, thereby increasing her working capital. She appreciates and values the loan, and she agrees to comply with the monthly repayments with great responsibility. (The town of Patria is known for the trade of forest products, as well as accommodation services and restaurants. It is also the entry point to Manu National Park).

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as cassava

loans.name: Françoise

texts.fr: françoise est une femme de 35 ans mariée mère de 2 enfants de 14 et 17 ans qui vont encore à l'école . Elle est commerçante et fait la vente en détail des vivres frais(tomate et autres)en fonction des saisons dans un marché de la place depuis des années. Elle a une bonne connaissance des fournisseurs, et surtout de sa clientèle qu'elle a acquise au fil du temps grâce à son expérience dans ce domaine. Mais elle se retrouve constamment en rupture de stock parce qu'elle est obligée de faire écouler tous le stock pour pouvoir s'en procurer à nouveau ceci à cause de la petitesse de son capital. Elle souhaitera augmenter son stock de cajots de tomates ce qui permettra de mieux satisfaire la demande constante de sa clientèle et d'éviter les ruptures de stocks. Elle économisera son bénéfice pour non seulement agrandir son activité mais aussi subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Françoise, age 35, is married with two children aged 14 and 17 who still go to school. She has been selling fresh seasonal produce (tomatoes and others) at retail at a local market for many years. She knows the suppliers well, and she is quite familiar with the clientele she built over time thanks to her experience in this activity.  

She regularly faces stock shortages. This is due to the fact that her capital is limited, which forces her to sell all her stock before she can afford to replenish it. She would like to stock up on crates of tomatoes to better meet customer demand and avoid further stock shortages. She will save her profits to expand her activity and to provide for her family’s needs.

loans.use: to stock up on crates of tomatoes.

loans.name: Talal

texts.en:
Talal is a 26-year-old single man from Lebanon. Since 2009, he has worked on his own as an accountant and computer programmer. Talal also works at a local association to earn supplemental income and live in good conditions. He works on a freelance basis and therefore needs to travel to serve customers all over the country. 

Talal is requesting a youth loan from the Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to perform needed maintenance on his car. His loan will enable him to respond promptly to customer demands. In the future, Talal wishes to own a proper office and execute his tasks from a permanent location.

loans.use: to maintain his car for his business

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Ekua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Ekua sells rice and beans in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 15 years. She is married to a driver, and together they have 6 children. Ekua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. 

Ekua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of rice and beans, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Ekua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of rice and beans, which will aid in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Madalena

texts.en:
Madalena is married, with five children (and none of the children goes to school). She takes care of additional family members. 

She sells charcoal at the market on both a wholesale and a retail basis. She has been in this business for 10 years. She works seven days a week.  She generates additional income through rental rooms and market vending.    

She has applied for a loan of UGX 3,000,000 from MCDT-SACCO to buy bags of charcoal. Her major business challenges include seasonality (the rainy season, which hinders her movements) and ever increasing prices of charcoal. 

She aspires of getting permanent business premises and also to buy a plot of land.  She resides in her own house; the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses include medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Saybior

texts.en:
Saybior is married, and has five children, three of whom attend school and one of whom does not live at home. She lives in New Kru, Liberia.  Her husband is a grade school teacher. For six years, she has been operating a shop selling charcoal by the bag.  She started this business by selling for her mother. The rainy season is her major challenge.

Saybior is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more bags of charcoal for her business. She plans is to open a food stuff shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Umidjon

texts.ru: Умидчон родился в 1979 года. Он живет вместе семьей сельской местности, который имеет хорошее условие для животноводства и выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур. Умидчон на воспитании имеет 3 детей. С целью получения дохода и обеспечения семьи, он более 14 лет занимается выращиванием сельхоз культур и скотоводством. Его жена помогает ему введению бизнеса. Он уже несколько лет хочет отремонтировать свой дом, так как его дом старый и имеет плохое состояние. Он запрашивает займ для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина и т.п. Умидчон очень надеется на Вашу благотворительность и милосердие.
texts.en:
Umidjon was born in 1979. He lives with his family in a rural area that has good conditions for raising animals and crops. Umidjon is raising three children. 

In order to generate income and support the family, he has been engaged for more than 14 years in the cultivation of crops and livestock. His wife helps him to conduct the business. 

For several years, he has wanted to repair their home, as the house is old and in a bad state. He is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials such as cement, wood, and the like.

loans.use: to buy cement and wood for repairing his house

loans.name: Maryluz

texts.es: Maryluz, tiene 27 años de edad trabaja vendiendo productos por catálogos de manera ambulante y a la vez estudia la carrera de Lic. en Contabilidad y Finanzas, su mayor deseo es prepararse y optar por una segunda carrera de idioma. Solicita este crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación de su profesión el cual está en la etapa final, lo que la llena de mucha alegría ya que estará cumpliendo con una de sus metas planteada.
texts.en: Maryluz is 27 years old, and works as a street vendor selling products through catalogues. She is also studying a degree in accounting and finance. Her greatest wish is to prepare for and choose a second degree path in languages. She is applying for this loan in order to be able to pay for the final-stage qualification of her profession, which makes her very happy as it will be fulfilling one of her set goals.

loans.use: to pay for qualification costs

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a single woman with no children. She lives in a rental house that has no piped water but has electricity. 

Fatuma has operated a cosmetic business for the past two years. Her potential customers are women. She dreams of earning more income and building her own house in the future. 

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase body lotions, braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oils, shampoos, and conditioners for resale. 

She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase body lotions, braids, weaves, hair chemicals, hair oils, shampoos, and  conditioners for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Norair

texts.en: Norair is 41 years old, married, and has one child. He lives in Akhalkalaki district. His wife works as an operator at local communication company and earns a small monthly income. Norair works as a driver at private company. He decided to start his own business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program  and Norair requested a loan for $5,000, which he will use to purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver. Norair is very experienced in this field, as he had been working as a driver many years and hopes that the business will be successful.

loans.use: to purchase a car and serve local people as a taxi driver

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley lives and works in St. Paul.   St. Paul is home to the oldest market in Liberia and is known for fish, due to its location by the sea. St. Paul is a suburb just outside Monrovia. It is one of the poorer areas, and you will often find its residents living in sub-standard housing. 

Shirley is 26 years old, married, with a 2-year-old child who is in pre-school and lives at home. 

For the past four years Shirley has been operating a table where she sells tablewear, bedsheets, etc.  She says sometimes sales are slow.

Shirley says she started this business with a little money she could afford from her susu (local daily saving), and she learned this trade from her friends. 

Shirley is requesting a loan to purchase more tableware, bedsheets, etc., for her business.  Her plans are to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase more tableware, bedsheets, etc., for her business

loans.name: Bassam

texts.en:
Bassam is a 29-year-old single Palestinian refugee, living and working in a Palestinian camp since he was born.

In 2009, he opened his own convenience store to improve his living. His business is going just fine, but he needs external financial support to make sure that he can reply to his increasing customer needs and requests.

Bassam is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to increase his business merchandise through special offers at good prices. He will also use part of the loan to buy furniture for his house. 

He hopes that in the future he will be able to open a larger shop.

loans.use: to increase his business merchandise with special offers with good prices, and necessary furniture for his house

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Ekua is a small-scale seller of pharmacy drugs in Domenase (near Cape Coast).  She has had some form of formal education, as she is a high school graduate. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a driver. 

Ekua has been working as a seller of pharmacy drugs for close to three years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. 

She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of drugs, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands. 

She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to fulfill her dream of buying a stand for her products, hence helping her sell from a fixed location in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of pharmacy drugs, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demands

loans.name: Mwanahai

texts.en:
Mwanahai is married and has eight children, one of whom attends school and the rest are adults. For the past two years, she has operated a timber selling business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. 

Mwanahai is requesting a loan from Yehu for 50,000 KES, which she will use to purchase more timber to sell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. Mwanahai dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber

loans.name: Amivi

texts.fr: Pour acheter plus de marchandises, Amivi sollicite un premier crédit à WAGES. Elle revend des produits d'alimentation générale dans sa boutique. A l'avenir, elle espère ouvrir un super marché et assurer une bonne scolarisation à son enfant. Mariée à un employé, elle est mère d'un enfant de 03ans. Elle est quant à elle âgée de 39ans.
texts.en: To purchase more merchandise, Amivi is requesting an initial loan from WAGES. She sells grocery products retail in her store. For the future, she hopes to open a supermarket and to ensure her child's education. Married to an employee, she is the mother of a 3-year-old child. As for herself, she is 39 years old.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell in her store

loans.name: Noa

texts.fr: Noa est une femme âgée de 59 ans, mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont l'âge varie entre entre 07 et 39 ans. elle mène une activité de vente de frais et plus précisément la tomate depuis 15 ans dans un marché de la place. elle sollicite à nouveau ce crédit augmenter son stock permanent de marchandise afin de résoudre le problème de rupture dont elle est souvent victime. elle bénéficie d'une bonne expérience dans le domaine. elle compte dans l'avenir agrandir son comptoir et diversifier sa marchandise afin de mieux assurer les frais de scolarité de ses enfants ainsi que leur condition de vie.
texts.en: Noa is a 59-year-old woman, married, and the mother of six children, from 7 to 39 years old. She has been running a business selling fresh foods, tomatoes to be exact, for fifteen years as a local market. She is requesting a new loan to increase her fixed inventory of merchandise, so as to resolve the problem of shortages to which she often falls victim. She benefits from good experience in this domain. For the future, she plans on expanding her table and diversifying her merchandise to be sure to cover children's schooling costs, as well as improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to restock her inventory of tomatoes

loans.name: Fazliddinkhon

texts.ru: Фазлиддинхон родился в 1994 года в сельской местности. Он с детства был трудолюбивым и помогал своим родителям по выращиванию сельхоз культур и скотоводству. Фазлиддинхон в этом году поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет по специальности Востоковедение. Он учится успешно и старается получить хорошие оценки. Фазлиддинхон в свободное время помогает своему отцу по земледелию. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Fazliddinkhon was born in 1994 in the countryside. Since childhood, he has been hard-working and helped his parents to cultivate crops and raise livestock. 

This year, Fazliddinkhon enrolled in the Khujand State University with a major in Oriental Studies. He is a good learner and is trying to get good grades. In his spare time, Fazliddinkhon helps his father to work the land. He needs to pay tuition but has no money.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Majd

texts.en:
Majd is 29 years old. He is a single man who lives in Sana`a, Yemen. He is an employee getting a low salary, who tries to work hard every day to be able to offer the best life. 

He is going to get married soon and he feels that his saved amount will not be enough to have furniture for his home. So, he is requesting a youth loan in order to purchase furniture to use for marriage. His dream is to own a big house and live a good life with his family.

loans.use: to purchase furniture to use for marriage.

loans.name: Mimi

texts.fr: Mimi est mère de 03 enfants dont 02 scolarisés. Pour  contribuer aux besoins de la famille, elle revend des sacs, des chaussures, des habits dans une boutique. Elle sollicite son premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter plus de marchandises afin de répondre aux besoins des clients. Le profit lui permettra d’agrandir son activité et d’assurer l’avenir de la famille.
texts.en: Mimi is a mother of three children, of whom two are in school. To help meet family needs, she sells handbags, shoes, and clothing in a store. She is requesting he first loan from WAGES to purchase more merchandise in order to respond to customer needs. The profit will enable her to expand her business and to ensure the family's future.

loans.use: to purchase handbags, shoes, clothing... to sell

loans.name: Om-Fatima Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Fatima, and it consists of four women who live in Sana'a, Yemen. They have requested a loan of YER 130,000 from AMB. 

Among the borrowers is Jamila, who is a hard-working homemaker. She and her husband have three children. She assists her husband in supporting their children because she knows her husband's income is not enough to provide the family for food and rent. Although her income is not very consistent, she does what she can to provide for the family. 

She has requested a loan from AMB to buy a washing machine for her home. She hopes to own a house, which will improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a washing machine for her home.

loans.name: Amonullohuja

texts.ru: Амонуллохуча энергичный молодой человек. Ему 18 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. В этом году он успешно окончил среднюю школу и поступил в Таджикский Государственный Медицинский Университет. Он учится хорошо и читает много книг. В свободное от занятий время, он работает разнорабочим и таким образом подрабатывает. Амонуллохоча во время каникулах, приезжает свой кишлак, так как он учится в столице. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Amonullohuja is an energetic young person. He is 18 years old. He is not married and lives with his parents. This year, he successfully graduated from high school and enrolled in the Tajik State Medical University. He is a good student and reads many books. 

In his free time, he works as a laborer and in this way makes additional earnings. During the holidays, Amonullohuja comes to his village since he studies in the capital. 

He needs to pay his tuition but has no money. He is requesting a loan to pay for his school contract.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Mama

texts.fr: Femme de 28ans, Mama se bat chaque fois pour apporter un avenir radieux à son enfant de 09ans scolarisé. Elle revend des boissons dans sa boutique depuis 2009 et sollicite un premier crédit pour acheter plus de marchandises.  Son souhait est d’ouvrir un nouveau dépôt et mieux suivre son enfant dans son cursus scolaire.
texts.en: A 28-year-old woman, Mama struggles constantly to bring a bright future to her 9-year-old child, who is in school. She has been selling beverages retail in her shop since 2009. She is requesting an initial loan to purchase more merchandise to sell. Her wish is to open a new outlet and to do better keeping up with her child's educational needs.

loans.use: to purchase beverages to sell

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Maame is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling provisions in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for a year now. 

Maame is married and has four children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Maame wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions. In the long term, Maame plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of provisions

loans.name: Karla Beatriz

texts.es:
Karla, vive con su familia, sus padres y no tiene hijos, asimismo no posee familiares en el extranjero. Ella, se dedica a la venta de lácteos, dicha actividad la aprendió de su familia y lo desempeña en los horarios de 5:00am a 3:00pm, ventaja que conoce del negocio mientras que la desventaja es la competencia.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar más productos de leche y equipo para poder mejorar la producción; esta inversión le ayudara a hacer más ágil y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
Su sueño es lograr adquirir un negocio fuerte de venta de lácteos.
texts.en:
Karla lives with her family, her parents, and she has no children. In addition, she has no family members outside the country. She sells dairy products, a business she learned from her family. Her work schedule is from 5:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m.  She has the advantage of knowing the business, while the disadvantage is competition. 

The loan she is requesting will allow her to buy more milk products and equipment, so that she can improve her output. This investment will help her offer faster and better service to her clients. Her dream is to succeed in having a strong business selling dairy products.

loans.use: To buy more milk products and equipment for improving her output.

loans.name: Shohsanamkhon

texts.ru: Шохсанамхон добросовестная и трудолюбивая девушка. Шохсанамхон родилась в сельской местности в семье простого строителя.  Шохсанамхон в 2002 году пошла в первый класс средней школы своего района. Шохсанамхон в школе училась хорошо, активно участвовала в общественных мероприятиях школы и в 2013 учебном году успешно закончила 11 класс. Она поступила на первый курс факультета экономики на очное отделение по договорной основе. Шохсанамхон  с детства мечтала стать экономистом,  как её мать. Ее отец трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации. Шохсанамхону пришлось обратиться в ИМОН с целью получение займа для оплаты суммы учебного договора, так как ее родители не в состоянии оплатить за ее учебный договор.  Шохсанамхон надеется на Вашу финансовую поддержку и хочет получить высшее образование.
texts.en:
Shohsanamkhon is a conscientious and hardworking young woman. Shohsanamkhon was born in a rural area into the family of a simple builder. In 2002, Shohsanamkhon went to the first class of the high school in her region. In school, Shohsanamkhon was a good student, actively participated in the community activities of the school and in the 2013 school year successfully completed grade 11. She enrolled on a contractual basis in the first year of the economics faculty in an internal department. Since childhood, Shohsanamkhon dreamed of becoming an economist like her mother. Her father is a migrant worker in the Russian Federation. 

Shohsanamkhon had to turn to IMON with the view of obtaining a loan to pay her tuition, since her parents are not in a position to pay her tuition. Shohsanamkhon hopes for financial support and wants to get a college education.

loans.use: to pay tuition

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena is 36 years old and lives in New Kru Town, one of the early communities in Liberia that is well known. She is married and has two children ages 3 and 20 who are presently in school and live at home. Helena did not attend school.

For the past 7 years she has been running a shop where she sells meat soup and fire-coal. She started this business by selling for her aunty and learned this way of selling from her friends. She is very happy with her business because she makes a lot of profits and it keeps her busy.  Most interestingly, she learned different kinds of local languages.

She is requesting a loan to buy more meat and fire-coal to increase her business. Her plans are to build another shop and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more meat and fire-coal to increase her business

loans.name: Anne

texts.fr: Anne est une femme de 48 ans fiancée mère de 8 enfants dont l'age varie entre 11 et 29 ans. Cinq de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. Elle commerçante et vend le bois de chauffage depuis 20 ans déjà. la maîtrise de son activité et son expérience lui sont d'une grande efficacité. elle a conquis et fidélisé une clientèle au fil du temps. Son activé fonctionne mais son capital n'est pas assez important pour qu'elle puisse s'en procurer ses marchandises en grande quantité et pour réaliser un bon bénéfice parce qu'elle son épouse à résoudre certains problèmes quotidiens grâce à cette activité. Grace à ce crédit,elle pourra s'acheter un camion de bois et 50 sacs de charbon ce qui augmentera considérablement son profit. Elle économisera une partie de ce bénéfice pour la scolarisation de ses enfants et réinvestira le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Anne is a 48 year old engaged woman and the mother of 8 children between the ages of 11 and 29. Five of her children are still in school. Anne is a shopkeeper and has been selling firewood for 20 years already. Her expertise in this business and her experience make her very efficent. She has acquired and maintained a steady customer base over time.

Anne's business is progressing but her capital is not large enough for her to be able to purchase her merchandise in large quantities in order to be able to earn a good profit, since she and her fiancé already use the proceeds from the business to care for their everyday expenses.

With this loan, Anne will be able to purchase a truckload of wood and 50 bags of charcoal which will increase her profit considerably. She will save a portion of the profits for her children's education, and will reinvest the remainder in her business..

loans.use: to buy a truckload of wood and 50 bags of coal.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta is married with a child. She has received some schooling until the end of junior high school.

Currently, Atta sells provisions in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this industry for about 2 years now. Her husband is a phone repairer. Atta’s income goes towards helping her husband pay for the family's general expenses.

Atta will use the loan to increase her existing provisions capacity. With the new profits from her expanded enterprise, Atta plans to develop her business further by venturing into newer markets.

loans.use: to increase her existing provisions capacity

loans.name: Aba

texts.en: Aba sells cooked rice and eggs on small scale in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has had some form of formal education as she is a middle school graduate. She is married and has five children. Aba has been selling cooked rice and eggs for close to eight years. Her income is used to help her husband pay the utility bills and their children’s school fees. She plans on using her loan to purchase an increased quantity of rice and eggs, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand. She hopes to use the profits from her enterprise to develop her business further and ensure that all her children receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased quantity of rice and eggs, thus allowing her to meet rising customers’ demand

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Esi did not have access to any formal education. Yet, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Esi sells provisions in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about five years. She is married to a farmer and together they have five children. Esi uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Esi will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of provisions, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Esi wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of provisions which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Nilufar

texts.ru: Нилуфар добродушная и целеустремленная девушка. Нилуфар родилась в сельской местности в семье простого рабочего.   Её отец погиб, когда ей было 3 года. Воспитанием Нилуфара занималась её мать. В детстве Нилуфар испытывала много трудностей. Её матери приходилось работать целые сутки, чтобы прокормить семью. Её мать работает поваром. Нилуфар в 2002 году пошла в первый класс средней школы своего района. Нилуфар в школе училась хорошо, активно участвовала в общественных мероприятиях школы и в 2013 учебном году успешно закончила 11 класс. После окончания средней школы она поступила на первый курс факультета Иностранных языков на очное отделение по договорной основе. Нилуфар с детства мечтала стать учительницей,  воспитывать много учеников. Но кроме зарплаты матери у неё нет другого источника дохода, чтобы оплатить договор. Поэтому она обратилась в нашу организацию с целью получения займа для оплаты суммы учебного договора. Нилуфар надеется на Вашу финансовую поддержку и хочет получить высшее образование.
texts.en:
Nilufar is a good-natured and ambitious young woman. Nilufar was born in a rural area to the family of a simple worker. Her father passed away when she was three years old. Nilufar's upbringing was handled by her mother. In childhood, Nilufar experienced many difficulties. Her mother had to work entire days to feed the family. Her mother works as a cook. 

In 2002, Nilufar went to the first class of the high school in her region. At school, Nilufar was a good student, actively participated in the school's community activities, and in the 2013 school year successfully completed the 11th grade. After graduating from high school, she enrolled in the first class of of the Faculty of Foreign Languages in an internal department on a contractual basis. 

Since childhood, Nilufar dreamed of becoming a teacher and educating many students. But despite her mother's salary, she has no other source of income to pay her tuition. Therefore, she turned to IMON in order to obtain a loan to pay her tuition amount. 

Nilufar hopes for financial support and wants to get a college education.

loans.use: to pay tuition at the university

loans.name: Asiya

texts.en:
Asiya is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school and one who is pre-school age. Asiya owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food .

Asiya operates a cereal-selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality.

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase sacks of maize, beans and rice for resale. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of maize, beans and rice for resale

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with one school-going child. She lives in a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills.

Fatuma operates a food-making business selling beans and chapati (flat bread) to passersby and neighbors. 

With the KES 20,000 loan, she wants to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establish a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase food items, wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and beans

loans.name: Maame

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances Maame did not have access to any formal education. Yet, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Maame sells watermelon and mangoes in Domenase (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about three years. As a single mother with two children, Maame uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Maame will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of watermelon and mangoes, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Maame wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of watermelon and mangoes, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.fr: Sylvestre est un jeune homme de 26 ans célibataire sans enfant. il est commerçant dans un marché de la place depuis 3 ans où il vend des vêtements des jeunes et des dames. à cause de la petitesse de son capital, il est obligé d’aller au déballage chaque week-end pour acheter en détail les vêtements qu'il expose dans son comptoir. Cela ne rapporte pas vraiment d'où l'importance de crédit pour son activité parce qu'il lui permettra d'acheter à nouveau un ballot mixte. il économisera le bénéfice que lui apportera ce crédit pour agrandir sa boutique de vêtements.
texts.en:
Sylvestre is 26 year old man. He is single and has no children. 

He has been working as a vendor at the local market for three years, selling children’s and women’s clothing. Because he is short on capital, he is forced to purchase clothing items every weekend, at retail prices, before displaying them at his stand. This does not bring in much revenue, which is why it is so important for him to receive a loan allowing him to purchase a bale of mixed clothing. 

He will save the revenues made possible through this loan in order to expand his clothing business.

loans.use: to buy a bale of clothing.

loans.name: Shuhrat

texts.ru: Шухрат в ИМОНе кредитуется первый раз. Он добросовестный и трудолюбивый человек и проживает в сельской местности, который имеет хорошее условие для животноводства и выращивания сельскохозяйственных культур. Шухрат женат и на воспитании имеет 3-х  несовершеннолетних детей. Он занимается животноводством и выращиванием сельхозкультур, имеет достаточный опыт по скотоводству и земледелия. В основном он выращивает пшеницу, ячмень, кукурузу, лук. В ведении данного бизнеса ему помогает жена. Раньше Шухрат ездил в Россию на заработки. Оставался там 6-7 месяцев и осенью возвращался домой, но по болезни уже 3-й год перестал ездить туда. Шухрат имеет 2 га условно поливной и 2 га богарной земли. Из-за отдалённости  источников поливной воды на орошение в летнее время он испытывает большие трудности. Чтобы снизить себестоимость продукции Шухрат не нанимает сезонных рабочих и все делает сам и его жена. Единственная проблема всех фермеров данного региона это отдалённость источников поливной воды, что снижает урожайность земли. Шухрат обратился за займом на бурение скважины, что намного облегчает проблему с поливной водой и тем самым повысить урожайность земли. Шухрат надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Shuhrat is borrowing from IMON for the first time. 

He is a diligent and hardworking person and lives in the countryside, which has good conditions for raising livestock and growing crops. Shuhrat is married and is raising three young children. He is engaged in livestock and crop cultivation, and has sufficient experience in livestock and agriculture. Mainly, he grows wheat, barley, corn, and onions. His wife helps in running the business. Previously, Shuhrat traveled to Russia for work. He remained there for 6-7 months and returned home in the autumn, but due to illness it is already the third year since he stopped going there. 

Shuhrat has two hectares of conventionally irrigated land and two hectares of rain-fed land. Due to the remoteness of sources for irrigation water in the summertime, he experiences great difficulties. To reduce the cost of production, Shuhrat does not hire seasonal workers and does all the work by himself with his wife. 

One of the problems for all the farmers in the region is the remoteness of sources of water for irrigation, which reduces the productivity of land. Shuhrat applied for a loan for drilling a well, which very much eases the problem with irrigation water and thus increases the yield of the land.

loans.use: to make a well for his land

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a 25-year-old married mother of two children. She works in the beauty industry with her husband. He is the hairdresser and she's the beauty and facial expert. Christine financially supports four of her family members.

She is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to buy new updated tools, machines and requested beauty materials to develop her business and expand her working sector.

Christine is well known in her region and highly recommended through her customers. She hopes that she can keep on developing her business and expanding her working sector to maintain continuity.

loans.use: to buy new updated tools, machines and requested beauty materials to develop her business

loans.name: Cabrita

texts.en:
Cabrita is 34 years old and married with three children. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. For nine years, Cabrita has been a farmer who plants, harvests, and sells coconuts while her husband worked as an Overseas Filapino Worker to make a living. 

Cabrita  requests a new loan since her generated revenue from her copra is not enough to cover the costs of its coconut farm weeding maintenance and fertilization. So in order to be financially settled, she borrowed a new loan from GDMPC of 14,000 PHP. She hopes  of having a better future with her family

loans.use: to cover the costs of coconut farm weeding  maintenance and fertilization

loans.name: Taleb

texts.en:
Taleb is a 30-year-old single man, responsible for the well-being of three members of his family. He has worked as a car mechanic for 17 years. His work is going on just fine, but his family's increasing needs force him to start an additional income-generating business. 

Today, Taleb is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, to buy a car that he'll fix and sell as a new source of income. He hopes that he will expand his business one day, and open new branches in the region.

loans.use: To buy a car that he'll fix and sell

loans.name: Cristina Santos

texts.es:
La Señora Cristina, de 35  años vive con su esposo en su casa de habitación ubicada en una aldea de San Lorenzo, Valle en la zona sur de Honduras, se dedica desde varios años a la venta de cerdos.
Doña Cristina engorda a los cerditos y luego los vende, su esposo  vende verduras, en el carro en donde diferentes lugares y esto le ayuda a salir de todos sus compromisos. 
Doña Cristina está solicitando el para comprar más cerdos y concentrados para poder seguir teniendo mercadería para la venta, es una buena clienta y ha manejado un buen comportamiento de pago está muy contenta de poder seguir trabajando con Prisma.
Doña Cristina su sueño es poder comprarse otro carro para seguir trabajando.


San Lorenzo, Honduras – Agosto del 2013.
texts.en:
Cristina, 35, lives with her husband in her house located in a village in San Lorenzo, Valle, in southern Honduras.  She’s worked several years selling pigs.

Cristina fattens up the piglets and then sells them.  Her husband sells vegetables from his car in various places and this helps her handle all of her commitments.

Cristina’s asking for the loan to buy more piglets and feed to continue having merchandise to sell.  She’s a good client and has a good payment history; she’s very happy to be able to continue working with Prisma.

Cristina’s dream is to be able to buy another car to continue working.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – August, 2013.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Binti

texts.en:
