Tiene grandes proyectos por desarrollar, uno de ellos es el construir en su casa un espacio que le sirva para colocar urnas y exhibir sus productos al estilo de un bazar, además desea en un futuro adquirir un vehículo que le facilite la distribución y comercialización.  Como ejemplo de su esfuerzo adquirió una computadora para que sus hijos tengan herramientas para el estudio y desea aprender a utilizarla en el negocio.
texts.en:
Elsa is 38 years old and has been selling products from a catalogue for four years as well as making cakes and selling cheese. She wants to help her children in their studies. 

Elsa began making cakes with her own capital, then she began to buy merchandise from Karla until the point where she started selling from her own catalogues. Now she would like to invest in this season's products. She continues to sell cheese and cakes, as well as diversifying her business by selling clothes from Nicaragua and other items from the catalogue.
 
Elsa receives income from the sale of different products. She sells cheese weekly and makes cakes to order. Her income has allowed her to cover the repayment of the loan she applied for, as well as purchasing goods which enabled her to increase her income and expand her portfolio for her clients. 

Thanks to her previous loan that was sourced by Fundación Mujer, she has experienced an important development in her business: she now has a client base who buy goods from her monthly. Elsa would like to invest in more products from the catalogue, since her years of work have garnered her royalties which she could capitalise on to obtain better earnings this season. Her husband is a fisherman who spends long periods away from home, which is why her business has made her the breadwinner of the family. 

Elsa has big projects she would like to develop, one of which is to make a space in her home where she could display vases and exhibit her products in the style of a bazaar. She would also like to acquire a vehicle in the future which would make the distribution and commercialisation of her products easier. Through her efforts she has acquired a computer so that her children have the tools they need to study. She would also like to learn how to use it for her business.

loans.use: to acquire goods, expand her catalogue of products and increase her sales

loans.name: Valeria Lucia

texts.en:
Valeria has always dreamed of becoming a nutritionist. Valeria was accepted into the Universidad Privada Domingo Savio Tarija and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees. She expects to graduate in November, 2013, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She says that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Valeria says that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. To help afford her school and living expenses, Valeria currently works 30 hours a week as a store clerk.

With a $102 loan, Valeria plans on spending the money towards purchasing her textbooks. Since they are an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Valeria hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. With a career in nutrition, she expects to earn $17 a day, a substantial increase from before. As the youngest in the family, with one older sibling attending college already, Valeria is unsure how she will be able to finance her education on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for books and school supplies.

loans.name: Jose Silvestre

texts.en:
Working in systems engineering is Jose's dream. Jose is currently attending the Universidad Salesiana de Bolivia, working towards his degree in business. He expects to graduate in December, 2013, but without a loan is unsure how he will be able to continue affording his education. He says that his alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until he could return. Jose says that it is important to him to graduate on time so he can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

With a $714 loan, Jose plans on using the funds to pay his tuition while he saves his salary from his part-time job. With a career in business, he expects to earn $25 a day, a substantial increase from before. To help afford his school and living expenses, Jose currently works 30 hours a week as a information technician and earns $5 a day.

loans.use: To pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Milton Nano

texts.en:
Becoming a professional has always been Milton's dream. To achieve his goal, Milton has enrolled in the Instituto Tecnológico Caranavi. He plans on graduating in December, 2014, but without a loan from Vittana he fears that he will need to defer his graduation. With this loan, Milton plans on spending the money towards purchasing his textbooks, which are often not purchased in order to save money. With them Milton hopes to be able to better understand his coursework. 

In addition to his responsibilities at school, Milton currently works 30 hours a week as a laborer and earns $13 a day. With a career in business, he expects to earn $17 a day. Unfortunately, Milton's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher education degree, his parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, finances have always been tight. With one younger brother and one younger sister, Milton hopes to be a role model for his younger siblings by being the first in his family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for books.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 28-year-old Lebanese single man. He has owned a clothing store since 2011. He is newly occupied by this type of business, but he is working really hard and shows very persuasive selling skills. He loves his job and always seeks the best. 

Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to increase his store’s inventory with a new winter collection. This season is about to begin, and he needs to get ready to satisfy his customers' demands. In the future, Hussein is looking forward to expanding his business into other areas, and in addition, he will start to sell shoes and women's accessories with the aim of earning higher income and living in better conditions.

loans.use: to increase his store’s inventory with a new winter collection.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel appreciates his previous Kiva loan that improved his living standards. His previous loan enabled him to expand his business and earn a higher income. In addition to the bakery business, Samuel has a motorbike, which he uses to transport people.  He is requesting a loan of ksh 50,000 to purchase spare parts for his motorbike. He thanks Yehu for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Rigoberto

texts.es:
Rigoberto de 53 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, esta casado desde hace 36 años, su pareja se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus tres hijos ya no viven con él, solo una hija de crianza y una nieta.

Él es agricultor y comerciante, tiene 12 años de dedicarse a la venta de frutas y verduras de forma ambulante y 5 años de haber puesto su propia tienda en su casa. El trabajo lo aprendió solo y decidió dedicarse a eso, porque lo que le genera la agricultura es poco. Desarrolla su trabajo solo y va a vender todos los días por la mañana.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar arroz, aceite, golosinas y otros artículos de primera necesidad; esto le ayudara a tener mejores ingresos  y satisfacer la demanda de compra que tiene en la comunidad y no vayan lejos a comprar.

Su objetivo, es instalar un puesto de venta en el mercado de su municipio, para ya no salir a vender fuera de su casa. Espera  que su familia tenga una vida digna y aprendan a luchar trabajando y que sean personas de bien. La ganancia del préstamo la invertirá en arreglar una parte de su casa, que por falta de dinero no ha podido terminar. Así, tendrá mas espacio para su familia.
texts.en:
Rigoberto, 53, went to school through sixth grade. He has been married for 36 years, and his wife works in the home. Their three children no longer live with them, but a foster daughter and a granddaughter do.

He is a farmer and shopkeeper with 12 years experience in traveling to sell fruits and vegetables. He also has 5 years experience of running his own shop from his home. He learned these skills on his own and decided to work in this sector because he doesn't earn much from farming. He developed his work himself and is going to sell every day in the mornings. 

He is requesting this loan to buy rice, oil, sweets, and other basic necessity items. This will help him have a better income and satisfy the purchasing demand in the community so people don't have to go far to shop.

His goal is to open a stall in his town's market so he doesn't have to go far from his home to sell anymore. Rigoberto wants his family to have a decent life and he wants them to learn to work hard and be good people. He will also invest part of the loan into repairing his home, since he wasn't able to finish this project, due to a lack of money. This will give his family more space.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, sweets, and other basic necessity items

loans.name: Celmy Rosario

texts.en:
Celmy dreams of becoming a accountant. Celmy was accepted into the Instituto Tecnico Superior Fe y Alegria and expects to graduate in March, 2014, but without a loan is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She says that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Celmy says that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. Celmy plans on spending her loan to purchase her textbooks, which are often not bought to save money. With them Celmy hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. 

With a career in business, she expects to earn $12 a day. Celmy's parents were never able to complete their primary education. With three older siblings, Celmy is unsure how she will be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan. Celmy is married with her own child, but this has not stopped her from pursuing her dreams. With a professional degree and a career in business, she will be able to provide her family with a better life. Celmy currently works 30 hours a week as a teacher to help afford her school and living expenses.

loans.use: To pay for books.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Yen is aged 36 and married. She has two children. Living in a village of the Cheung Prey district, Yen is a rice farmer, who grows rice on one hectare of farmland. Having been in this business for several years, she manages to earn about 24,000 KHR per day to feed her family and children.

Yen has requested a loan with VisionFund. She completely repaid the past three loans, which has enabled her family to buy a plot of farmland. With this loan, she is going to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Ma Clementina

texts.es:
Doña Ma Clementina tiene una edad de 42 años con un grado de educación cursado hasta el quinto grado de primaria y su esposo curso hasta cuarto grado. Su primer hijo tiene 23 años de edad curso el ciclo común y no siguió estudiando ya que prefirió apoyar a su padre, el segundo hijo tiene 21 años se graduó de bachillerato en técnico en computación, el tercer hijo tiene 18 años curso ciclo común, el cuarto hijo tiene 16 años de edad esta en primer año de carrera y está estudiando bachillerato en computación e informática y el último de sus hijos tiene 16 meses de nacido. Su actividad económica es el cultivo de café y compra de vivero al final de cada cosecha el producto es distribuido en las bodegas de la ubicadas en las zonas aledañas. Sus cultivos están al lado de su casa de habitación la cual tiene entrada para vehículo pero ellos se trasladan a pie. Fueron sus padres que desde pequeña le enseñaron esta actividad y el terreno donde ella cultiva fue herencia de por parte de ellos en el cual al momento de su mantenimiento y demás actividades se involucran todos los miembros de su hogar.

Doña Ma Clementina tiene como meta dar a sus cultivos la mejor asistencia posible para poder obtener una excelente cosecha pudiendo generar mayores ingresos y poder seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios ya que para ella es una prioridad que sus hijos se preparen. Por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento con el cual comprara 4 QQ de urea, 4 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 4 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0 para asistir sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ma Clementina is 42 years old and attended primary school through the fifth grade.  Her husband went through the fourth grade.  Her first child is 23 years old and finished middle school.  He did not continue studying since he preferred to support his parents.  Her second child is 21 years old and graduated from technical high school with a degree in computers.  Her third child is 18 years old and finished middle school.  Her fourth child is 16 years old and is studying in computers and information technology in high school.  Her last child is 16 months old.  

She works cultivating coffee and buying from nurseries at the end of each harvest.  Her product is distributed in the warehouses located in nearby areas.  Her crops are located next to her home.  It can be reached by car, but they travel on foot.  Her parents taught her this work when she was young and the land she plants was an inheritance from them.  Today, the crop maintenance and other farming activities involve all of the members of the household.

Ma Clementina's goal is to give her crops the best help possible to obtain an excellent harvest so that she can generate more income and continue supporting her children with their studies, since it is a priority for her that they are educated.  

She is requesting a loan to purchase four quintals of formula 12-24-12 and four quintals of formula 18-46-0 to assist her crops.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her coffee crops.

loans.name: Kimly's Group

texts.en:
Kimly, 34, is married and lives with her family in a village of the Sa Ang district. She has four children, some of whom are still in school. To make a living, she has been selling clothes while her husband plants mango to earn additional income. The current business earns her about 8,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

There are three members in Kimly’s loan group and she has been with VisionFund for two cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her mango plantation and use a portion of it to spend on buying more clothes to resale. She hopes to increase her family’s income from her current business so as to make a living better and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her mango plantation.

loans.name: Luz Patricia

texts.en:
Luz dreams of becoming a professional, but without a degree it may never be possible. Luz is currently attending the Universidad Mayor De San Andrés, working towards her degree in tourism. She expects to graduate in December, 2014, but without a loan, she is unsure how she will be able to continue affording her education. She says that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. For Luz, it is important to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. With this loan, Luz plans on paying her graduation fees. These fees are often more expensive than the semester's tuition and are a frequent impediment for graduating students in Bolivia. 

In addition to her responsibilities at school, Luz currently works 30 hours a week independently and earns $15 a day. With a degree in business, she expects to earn $20 a day. 

Luz's parents were never able to complete their primary education. For her family, finances have always been tight. Luz hopes to be a role model for her younger brother by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Betty Lucila

texts.es: Doña Betty es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Tiene 58 años de edad Y madre soltera de 7 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de ropa, cosmético y calzado desde hace 4 años. Inicio este negocio con dinero propio, luego solicito créditos en diferentes  bancos, con el objetivo de invertir en su negocio y tener variedad de productos para ofrecer. Comercializa sus productos en su casa y tiene como expectativa  dar a conocer su negocio en el mercado, ya que es un lugar donde muchas personas visitan. Solicita el crédito para comprar: blusas, camisas, pantalones, calcetines, maquillaje, perfumes, cremas, sandalias, deportivos, zapatos etc. con el fin de diversificar sus productos y abastecer a sus clientes. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda para aumentar sus ventas, ya que tendrá ofertas para sus clientes. Su plan futuro es expandir su negocio y mejorar la infraestructura de su casa. Se considera una persona proactiva que a pesar de no recibir ayuda de nadie, ella ha salido a delante.
texts.en:
Betty is originally from the city of Managua.  She is 58 years old and a single mother to seven children.  She has worked as a merchant selling clothing, cosmetics, and shoes for four years.  She started this business with her own money and later requested loans from different banks with the goal of investing in her business so that she could offer a variety of products.  She sells her products from her home and she hopes to move her business to the market, since it is a place many people visit.  

She is requesting this loan to purchase blouses, shirts, pants, socks, makeup, perfume, lotions, sandals, athletic clothing, and shoes so that she can diversify her products and stock for her customers.  She thinks that this loan will help increase her sales, since she can have sales for her customers.  Her future plans are to expand her business and improve the condition of her house.  She considers herself a proactive person since she has succeeded in spite of not receiving help from anyone.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, shirts, pants, socks, makeup, perfume, lotion, sandals, athletic clothes, and shoes.

loans.name: Rubi Ines

texts.en:
Rubi is majoring in English because she believes it will benefit her career in the long run. Rubi was accepted into the First Class Institute and now, with the chance to achieve her dream, she is concerned about affording tuition fees. She plans on graduating in December, 2013, but often there are fees for earning your title in business before graduating. Without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school. With a $729 loan, Rubi plans on using the loan to cover the cost of her graduation fees. 

One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. To help afford her school and living expenses, Rubi currently works 30 hours a week as a teacher trainee. 

With one younger brother and two younger sisters, Rubi hopes to be a role model for her younger siblings by being the first in her family to graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for graduation fees.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
For many years, Adam worked with musicians and companies recording and producing music and music videos and advertisements. Recently, he decided to go into business for himself and created Reanimator Media, a media company out of his new residence, Houston, Texas. Originally from Los Angeles, Calif., Adam works with one of the top acting agencies, which he says allows him to network with more musicians, actors and people they know.  

At 25 years of age, Adam says he can’t say exactly how many artists he’s worked with throughout the entire span of his business, but he says he’s worked with at least 20 bands within the past 12 months. “I’ve been doing this for a long time and recently decided to make it a full-time deal,” he says. And since he is new to having a registered business, Adam had to learn how to obtain more capital. 

While doing an online search for lenders, he found nonprofit microlender, Accion Texas Inc. Once he applied and was approved, he was able to rent a studio, pay monthly fees and charge other bands for his services and facilities. Before the Accion loan, Adam was paying studio fees by the amount of time spent;, and the fees quickly added up. But his Accion venture will save the business money, which could be used on Adam’s one full-time employee, or anywhere else.

Adam’s business, however, isn’t just for musicians looking to record their latest album. Adam’s skills allow him to manage sound and lighting equipment for live shows, and his networking skills allow him to always stay employed. He says since he’s worked with many other artists, bands are learning the name Reanimator Media and are seeking him when they need to rent equipment.

Adam has plans to market his business through a clothing line named Occeus Couture. Accompanying Occeus’ owner, their main designer will travel from Florida to Houston to open a new store. And to promote their upcoming grand opening, Reanimator was hired to complete marketing projects. Adam says this will help both businesses. The campaign will try to show other companies that his business doesn’t work solely with bands, but with major companies as well. To learn more, check out Reanimator Media’s Facebook page for upcoming events and Adam’s latest information: https://www.facebook.com/#!/ReanimatorMedia/.

loans.use: to rent a studio in order to charge bands for his services and facilities.

loans.name: Juvita

texts.en: Juvita is 30 years old, and she is married. She has a carpentry business to generate income for her family. She has been thinking how to run a big business, but she does not have enough working capital. She felt better when she applied for her first loan, and now she is applying for her second loan of $1,500. She will buy some additional supplies to keep in her store, such as wood, saws, wood-cutting machines, machetes and a wood-hollowing machine. She is happy that TRM (Tuba Rai Metin) offers loan to poor people.

loans.use: to buy wood, saws, wood-cutting machines, machetes and a wood-hollowing machine.

loans.name: Nedilen

texts.en:
Nedilen resides in Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, in the Phillipines, with her family. Her husband is a fisherman, while Nedilen sells fish to make a living. 

In 2011, she joined Gata Daku MPC, and now she has borrowed PHP 7,000  to purchase more seafood to sell. 

She wants to generate more revenue this year in order to have an additional working capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more seafood to sell

loans.name: Viktorya

texts.en:
Viktorya is an experienced agronomist from the village Banavan of Ararat region. She has run her agribusiness for more than 10 years. Viktorya lives with her husband and son, who help her in selling the agricultural products in the local market. Agribusiness is an important source of the family's income and plays an essential role in their lives. 

Viktorya cultivates tomatoes, peaches, apples and plums. Now she and her family want to expand the cultivation of the fruits and vegetables. A loan of $3,000 will be a great support for the hardworking family for purchasing new land and some fertilizers. They rely on the lenders' support to gather the needed amount of financial resources and to continue their hard work.

loans.use: to pay for new land and fertilizers.

loans.name: Thal's Group

texts.en:
Thal is 52 and married with four children, one of whom is still in school. Her family lives in a village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province and she and her husband earn a living through farming rice and raising pigs. Thal has been in this business for thirty years and earns about 7,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. She has been with VisionFund for four cycles and her past loans have helped her family relieve their financial burden to a great extent. 

Thal is the leader of a loan group applying for another loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion of the loan to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland. Thal plans to use her loan to grow more crops to sell for a good price to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Levi Noemy

texts.es:
Leivi de 24 años de edad, es una cliente desde hace ya un año. Se acompaño a los 15 años, producto de la relación tienen una niña de 6 años de edad, que actualmente estudia primer grado en el centro escolar de la comunidad, el cual esta a unos 50 metros de donde residen.

Su compañero de vida trabaja en la albañilería y también en la agricultura. En la casa donde reside con su hija y su compañero de vida, también viven los suegros. Gracias al esfuerzo de ella y de su compañero han logrado construir su vivienda en el terreno de los suegros de ella.

Leivi, procede de una familia de ocho hermanos (tres varones y cinco hembras) siendo ella la ultima de la familia,  se creció trabajando en la agricultura, ella estudio hasta el séptimo grado del nivel básico.


Ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y otros antojitos cuatro veces a la semana, en la comunidad donde reside, durante las tardes. Aprendió gracias a su hermana mayor, quien le enseño el trabajo, se decidió pues ya tenia su propio hogar y tenia que ayudar a su compañero de vida ha salir adelante. También, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y aves de corral, que los crece y engorda para luego venderlos, ya tiene mas de tres años de experiencia.

Los insumos para la venta de pupusas, los compra en la ciudad mas cercana, tiene que caminar por 20 minutos hasta llegar a la calle donde toma el bus, el cual recorre cerca de 40 minutos para llegar y comprar  los insumos, lo hace cada 8 días.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para comprar tres cerdos valorados en $ 225.00, el resto del dinero lo necesita para construir un cafetín de madera y lamina en la comunidad, donde ella pueda vender los antojitos y pupusas a los clientes, ya que es una zona muy transitada que esta cerca de la escuela de la comunidad.

Con el crédito obtendrá mayores ingresos económicos, que le permitirán darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hija, con ello contribuir al sostenimiento del hogar.


 planifica en el futuro tener un negocio mas fortalecido, donde pueda ofrecerle a los clientes productos de la canasta básica, sueña darle el estudio a su pequeña hija y mejorar poco a poco su vivienda.
texts.en:
Leivi, age 24, has been a client for a year now.  She has been involved with someone since she was 15 years old. Coming from that relationship, she has six year old daughter who currently studies in the first grade in the community school, which is about 50 meters from where they live.

Her partner works in construction and also agriculture. Her in-laws also live in the house where she lives with her daughter and partner. Thanks to her efforts and those of her partner, they have managed to build a home on the land of her in-laws.

Leivi comes from a family of eight siblings (three brothers and five sisters); she is the last sibling in the family. She grew up farming. She studied until the seventh grade.

She works selling pupusas (a treat made from stuffed corn dough) and other traditional treats during the afternoons four times a week in the community where she lives. She learned this thanks to her older sister, who taught her the job. She decided to do this because she already had her own home and had to help her partner to get by. She also works raising pigs and poultry, which she grows and fattens so that she can then sell them. At this point she has three years of experience.

She buys the supplies for her pupusa sales in the closest city. She has to walk twenty minutes to get to the street where she catches a bus. The bus travels around 40 minutes to arrive and buy the supplies. She does this once a week.

The loan that she is asking for is to buy three pigs, valued at $225.00. She needs the rest of the money to construct a snack shop in the community from wood and metal sheeting. She can sell traditional snacks and pupusas to her customers, because the neighborhood is in a high-traffic area near the community school.

With the loan she will get a higher income, which will allow her to give her daughter a better quality of life. She will also contribute to the support of her home.

She plans to have a stronger business in the future, where she can offer her customers basic staples. She dreams of being able to give her daughter an education and to improve her house little by little.

loans.use: to buy three pigs valued at $225.00. She needs the rest of the money to construct a wooden and sheet metal snack stand in the community, where she can sell traditional snacks and stuffed corn treats to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
María, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo, ya que estos le han ayudado a trabajar en la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo y cuenta que es un recurso para trabajar e incrementar sus ganancias; esta inversión le permitirá comprar los insumos agrícolas, tales como: abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas,  mantenimiento para el ganado y aves de corral.
Comenta el cliente que tuvo un efecto muy significativo, ya que ha mantenido un negocio estable y rentable que le genero ingresos económicos, es por ello que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
María has met with a need to opt for a new loan, because for a long time the loans have helped her to farm and she says that it is a resource to work with and increase her earnings. This investment will allow her to buy agricultural supplies such as fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides, and maintenance for cattle and poultry.

The client says that it had a significant effect, because she has kept a stable and profitable business that generates a good income for her. It is because of this that her economic conditions and family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicides, pesticides, insecticides and maintenance for cattle and poultry.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife, who is 38 years old, dreams of becoming rich. In order to attain this, she must work harder, and Marife sets her mind to this. She is a mother of two, both in school.  Her husband operates motorcycle transport for them to have a source of daily income. 

Marife is extending her tailoring service to their community.  From 10 years in the business, she has a lot of experience dealing with clients.

She is asking for a loan that she will use to repair her sewing machine and buy more kinds of fabrics, needles, and thread to further expand her tailoring services.

Marife's and her husband's combined income ranges from PHP 1,000 to PHP 1,500 every week.  This is used to support the education of her children and for daily food consumption and loan amortizations.  Anything left over will go to her savings.

loans.use: to repair her sewing machine and buy more kinds of fabrics, needles, and thread for her tailoring services

loans.name: Samann

texts.en:
Samann is 32 and married with two children. She lives with her family in a village of the Moung Russey district. Samann is a farmer and her husband sometimes earns additional income by working for others for a fee. She currently earns about 10,000 KHR each day for her family. Samann has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has successfully repaid her past loans. 

Samann is requesting a 2,000,000 KHR loan to buy fertilizer for her farmland and pay for labor. In the future, she hopes to earn more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Vanny

texts.en:
Vanny is 27 and married with a daughter who is too young for school. She lives with her family in a village of the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Vanny and her husband are rice farmers and they supplement their income through planting pineapple. She has been in this business for several years and she earns about 34,000 KHR per day. Vanny has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has successfully repaid her previous loans that have helped her family relieve their financial burden and improve their livelihood. 

Vanny is requesting a 2,500,000 KHR loan through VisionFund to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes her loan will increase her crop yields and her income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 36 years old and married. She and her husband are blessed with three children. For almost five years, Marilyn has owned and operated a junk shop in her village. She earns a net income of 2,000 PHP each week.

Marilyn is requesting a 35,000 PHP loan to purchase used plastic bottles, old tires, and steel to resell. She hopes that her request will be granted so that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: to purchase used plastic bottles, old tires, and steel to resell

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson appreciates his previous loan that he used to improve his living standards. He was able to expand his business and earn a higher income.

Anderson is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to purchase spare bicycle parts for his business. He thanks Yehu for its financial support.

loans.use: to purchase spare bicycle parts for his business

loans.name: Nelly Elena

texts.es:
Nelly, vive con sus padres en casa de los mismos, su madre le ayuda con el negocio, ya que ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de bisutería y artesanías, dicha actividad la realiza en casa y posteriormente sale a venderlo a oficinas y viviendas.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar diversidad de materiales para la elaboración de collares y pulseras; esta inversión le ayudara a adquirir la materia prima y tener surtido el negocio, con ello vender más.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y obtener ganancias para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Nelly lives with her parents in their home. Her mother helps her with her business through which she makes a living producing and selling jewelry and crafts. She performs this activity at home and afterwards goes out to sell her products in offices and homes.

The loan that she is requesting will allow her to buy a variety of materials for the production of necklaces and bracelets. This investment will help her to acquire raw materials and have her business supplied, which means that she can sell more.

Her dream is to grow her business and obtain profits to provide a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay coffee pruners

loans.name: Gudelia

texts.en:
Gudelia is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

Hello my name is Gudelia. I have 10 years' experience with my laundry shop. The business was left to me by my former husband, and through hard work I have been able to make it grow. It is located inside a market so I have many recurring clients. I will use the loan to refurbish the place, and that way I will be able to attract more customers. I consider myself to be creditworthy because I always pay my debts on time. My biggest accomplishment is being able to provide financial stability to my kids.

loans.use: to paint and refurbish my laundry shop

loans.name: Artsvi

texts.en:
Artsvi is a self-employed farmer from the village of Bandivan in the Shirak region. He lives with his wife, daughter, and son, and he breeds cows, sheep, and hens. Artsvi’s family also cultivates wheat and his family helps a lot with his everyday farming activities. These are the only sources of the family’s income and they sell their agricultural products in the local market. Artsvi’s family is very hardworking and eager to maintain and expand their agricultural business.

Artsvi is requesting a 3,000 USD loan to buy some forage for his livestock, obtain seeds to cultivate wheat, renovate machinery, and purchase fuel. He will use his loan to help reach these goals and maintain his farming businesses.

loans.use: to buy livestock forage, obtain seeds to cultivate wheat, renovate machinery and purchase fuel

loans.name: Behruz

texts.ru:
Бехруз молодой житель района Дж.Руми. Ему 26 лет. Он с юного возраста занимается растениводвством и выращивает сельскохозяйственную культуру. У него имеется 3 га участка фермерской земли. Бехруз женат и живет с женой у своих родителей. Его отец работает заместителем председателя Хукумата (местная власть) района Дж.Руми.  
В данный момент Бехруз хочет начать животноводческий бизнес. Данный бизнес считается прибыльным, так как спрос на мясо всегда высокий. Бехруз просит кредит на сумму 2000$ для открытия своего дела «откорм и продажа крупнорогатого скота». Бехруз имеет все условия для развития данного бизнеса. Ему будет помогать его жена.  От прибыли они собираются расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Buhruz is a young resident of the J. Rumy region.  He is 26 years old, and since he was young he has grown field crops.  He has 3 hectares of farm land.  He is married, and he and his wife live with his parents.  His father is the deputy chairman of the Hukumat (the local government) of the J. Rumy region.

At the present time, Buhruz wants to start a business in animal husbandry.  Such businesses are profitable because there is always strong demand for meat.  Behruz is asking for a loan of $2,000 (USD) to start his business in fattening large cattle for resale.  Behruz has everything required to develop his business and he will be helped by his wife.  They plan to use their profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy two head of cattle

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Vicky is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

Hello, my name is Vicky. I am a 48-year old woman and entrepreneur who loves my work, and I am always looking for ways to expand it. I started my business 18 years ago. It is a small shop where I sell candies, gifts, and other stuff. I will use the loan to buy inventory -- that way I will have more product variety and will be able to increase sales, because the upcoming months are the best of the year for sales. In september we have the Mexican independence holidays and later other celebrations.

I am a single mother, and one of my biggest accomplishments has been providing financial stability to my son and growing my business.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as candies and gifts

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 28 years old and married with four children, some of whom are too young to attend school. She runs a kiosk in front of her house where she sells clothing. Lucia’s kiosk is located nearby a school and is in a strategic place that attracts many people including students.

Lucia is requesting a 1,200 USD loan from Tuba Rai Metin to buy stocks of shirts, shorts, long pants, and children’s clothing to sell. She makes good money and hopes to apply for bigger loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy shirts, shorts, long pants, and children’s clothing

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

Hi my name is Emilia. I am 40 years old and have been working for the last 10 years. I started my food stall, in which I sell Mexican food. I enjoy working because I get to meet many people. I also earn extra income by helping a friend sell vitamin and food supplements, and she gives me a percentage of each sale. I live with my partner and have four sons. We all live with my mother. I will use the loan to refurbish my food stall and buy some chairs and inventory. I believe that if I improve the presentation, I will be able to get more clients.

My biggest accomplishment has been providing financial stability to my family.

loans.use: to refurbish my food stall and buy some inventory

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru:
Зарина замужняя женщина в возрасте 43-х лет. Она вместе с мужем и детьми проживает в городе Вахдат недалеко от столицы. Ее муж работает в гимназии завхозом. Дети учатся в школе. Сама Зарина 6 лет тому назад имела торговый бизнес, однако по причине обстоятельств она вынуждена была прекратить свой бизнес. 
Сейчас она решила заново начать свой бизнес, так как дети уже подросли и она может посвятить себя работе. Для осуществления своей цели Зарина обратилась за кредитом. У нее имеется собственный магазин. На сумму кредита и своего сбережения Зарина хочет приобрести продукты питания, чтобы открыть магазин и приступить к продажам.  В дальнейшем она планирует расширить свой бизнес и открыть еще одну точку продажи. Она счастлива, что снова будет независимой. Ведь согласитесь это приятное ощущение ни от кого зависеть и позволять себе и детям всякие радости.
texts.en:
Zarina is 43 years old and married.  She, her husband, and children live in Vahdat, a city not far from the capital.  Her husband works as an administrative manager in the school their children attend.  Zarina had her own business until six years ago when circumstances forced her to close it.

Now she has decided to restart her business, since her children have already grown up a bit and she can dedicate herself to her business.  To realize her goal, Zarina applied for a loan.  She already has her own shop.  With the loan funds and her own savings, Zarina wants to buy grocery items in order to open her store and start selling.  She plans on expanding her business in the future and open a second store.  She is very happy that she will again be independent.  You'll have to agree that it's a pleasant feeling to know that you don't have to rely on anyone and that you can allow yourself and your children some of the fun things in life.

loans.use: to buy grocery items and open a store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal and feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Temboni Group

texts.en:
Oliver, who is is in her late 30s, is widowed with three daughters. Oliver's children are enrolled in school. For two years now, she has been managing her life by running two businesses. Her retail shop sells dry food items like flour, rice, airtime, cooking oil, etc. She also manages a poultry business. She works from 7 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good returns every month.

This will be her second loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used her previous loans to maintain and replace her retail shop inventory and has paid back her entire previous loan successfully . She will use this loan to buy more chicks and increase stock items in the shop. With the profit earned, she paid school fees and managed to cover household expenses. Oliver's dreams to own a bid business in future. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "TEMBONI," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more chicks and increase stock items in the shop.

loans.name: Ana Daysi

texts.es:
Ana, requiere optar por un nuevo préstamo porque necesita más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio de elaboración y venta de tortillas; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar la materia prima, tales como: maíz y leña, entre otros. 
Cuenta la Sra. Ana que el crédito anterior que fue satisfactorio, ya que su clientela ha crecido y han mejorado sus ventas. Las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares se han optimizado porque tienen una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana needs a new loan because she needs more working capital to continue with her business of making and selling tortillas.  This investment will help her to buy raw material like corn, firewood, and others.

Ana says that the previous loan was satisfactory.  He clientele has grown, and her sales have improved.  Her financial condition and family circumstances have been optimal.  This is because they have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy raw material like corn, firewood, and others.

loans.name: Socheat's Group

texts.en:
Socheat is 34 years old and is married with two children. She lives in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district, Cambodia. One of Socheat’s children is still small and the other one is in school. For the past ten years, Socheat has been a farmer who plants corn. She earns about 22,000 KHR each day. Socheat has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles and has successfully used her previous loans to better support her family and business. 

Socheat is the leader of a group that is requesting a loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland. Socheat hopes to increase her crop yields and income to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and fertilizer for her farmland

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
La señora Virginia de 74 años de edad,  trabaja fuertemente la agricultura y la crianza de especies menores.
Se caso a los 22 años de edad,  del matrimonio nacieron 8 hijos (cuatro hembras y cuatro varones) todos mayores de edad y que ya viven con sus propias familias; su esposo murió hace 6 años.  
Durante su juventud nunca estudio, al igual que sus cuatro hermanos, pues sus padres le decían que el estudio es  el trabajo en la agricultura.

Ella adquiere, los cerdos para la crianza y el engorde en las comunidades cercanas, el abono para las milpas lo compra en la ciudad mas cercana, tiene que ir en bus y viajar por 40 minutos hasta llegar al lugar. Aprendió, a trabajar gracias a sus padres, desde pequeña ella les ayudaba a hilar  pitas (hilo) para la elaboración de hamacas y luego se iba cada domingo a las plazas a venderlas con su madre, también iba en las temporadas a trabajar con la cuma a los cerros para preparar la tierra y sembrar los cultivos de maíz y frijol.

Hoy en día ella ha sembrado con la ayuda de sus hijos 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 3,500 de frijoles, de los  cuales tiene que estar pendiente todos los días.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar tres cerdos $ 225.00 y aves de corral $100.00 y el resto lo invertirá en la agricultura. Con el ingreso de la venta de los cerdos y la crianza de aves de corral, obtendrá ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de ella y de su nieto. Así mismo, espera obtener muy buenas cosechas y asegurar la alimentación para su familia.

En el futuro planifica mejorar la cocina del hogar, pues esta dañado el techo, también seguir trabajando con las aves de corral, cerdos y trabajar en la agricultura (siembra de maíz y frijoles). Ademas, darle a su nieto el estudio que no tuvo en su juventud.
texts.en:
Señora Virginia, age 74, works hard at farming and small animal husbandry.  She got married at age 22. From her marriage, she had 8 children (four daughters and four sons). All of them are now grown up and live with their own families; her husband died six years ago. She never studied when she was young, the same as her siblings, because their parents told them that farm work was their school.

She gets pigs to raise and fatten from the surrounding communities. She buys fertilizer for her fields in the closest city. She has to go by bus and travel about 40 minutes to get there.  She learned to work thanks to her parents. From the time she was small, she helped them to weave hammocks, and then every Sunday she went to the plazas to sell them with her mother. She also would go with a machete to the hills to prepare the soil and sow the corn and bean crops.

Currently, with the help of her children she has sown 7,000 square meters of corn and 3,500 of beans. Every single day she has to keep watching and waiting for her crops.

The loan she is asking for is to buy three pigs ($225.00) and poultry ($100.00); she will invest the rest in farming. With the income from the sale of the pigs and the poultry-raising, she will get a better income for the support of herself and her grandchild. She hopes to get a very good harvest and ensure her family’s diet.

In the future, she plans to improve the kitchen in her home, because it is damaging the roof. She will also keep working with poultry, pigs, and farming (sowing corn and beans). Additionally, she will give her grandchild the schooling she didn’t have in her own childhood.

loans.use: to buy three pigs ($225) and poultry ($100). She will invest the rest in farming.

loans.name: Sophorn's Group

texts.en:
Sophorn, aged 26, is a married mother of two children, living in a rural village of the Moung Russey district, in Cambodia. To support her family, Sophorn has been farming rice in the village. The current business earns her about 24,000 KHR per day.

Sophorn has been with VIsionFund for one previous loan cycle. She has successfully used the previous loan from VisionFund to better support her family and business. Now requesting another loan, she will use her portion of this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yield and sell it for a good price, to make a better living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Manuel is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story.

Hello my name is Manuel. I am 55 years old, married and have three sons. The oldest is a public accountant, my daughter is an English teacher, and the youngest is studying to become a chef. I started my business 18 years ago. I take photos and sell frames and related stuff. I am creditworthy, always paying my debts on time. I will use the loan to buy some supplies for my business. My biggest accomplishment is seeing my kids graduate from university.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for my photography and frames

loans.name: Sandra Erika

texts.en:
Sandra (pictured with a customer) is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.

Hello my name is Sandra. I am 33 years old. I am married and have one son. I have been working in retail for 15 years. I started because my mother used to sell women's clothes. Later I started my own business selling beauty supplies. I also like to paint and do handcrafts that I sell.

I will use the loan to buy inventory for the high sales season. My goal is to grow my business. My biggest accomplishment is remodeling my home and growing my business.

loans.use: to buy inventory such as beauty supplies for my high sales season.

loans.name: Chari

texts.en:
Chari is a hardworking and enterprising woman who lives in her own house. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

Chari operates a clothes selling business. She sells in a shop to town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces the major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the 80,000 KES she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a hardworking and enterprising woman. For the past two years, she has operated a kiosk where she sells products to her neighbors and passersby. Margaret’s greatest business challenges are seasonality and theft. She owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expense is food. Margaret decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Margaret is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, sweets, biscuits, and cooking oil. In the future, she dreams of establishing a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase bread, milk, soft drinks, sweets, biscuits, and cooking oil

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna and her spouse are farmers.They live in Iguig, planting and harvesting rice to sell. They have been in the farming business for over ten years and usually make 20,000 PHP each harvest season (twice a year). Generated income goes toward their daily consumption, education, and revolving capital for the business. 

Edna is now asking for a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fertilizers and insecticides, which will be used in the improvement of her farming. She knows that this loan amount will help ensure good nutrition for her crops which will lead for better crop production and profits someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides used in farming

loans.name: Josefina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Josefina de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado de educación básica, esta acompañada desde hace 3 años. El padre de sus hijos se fue hace 12 años, su pareja actual se dedica a la agricultura al igual que ella. En casa de la señora viven nada más 4 personas, un hijo de 18 años que se dedica a la agricultura y un nieto de 6 años que estudia ella y su compañero de vida.  

Ella es agricultora desde hace 38 años, el trabajo se lo enseño su papá, otro ingreso que ella tiene es la venta de pasteles y fruta preparada. Su lugar de trabajo esta a 4 cuadras de su casa, se traslada caminando y a veces en carreta, su compañero de vida, es quien le ayuda en su trabajo de agricultura.

El préstamo que esta solicitando es, para comprar semilla, abonos, herbicidas y la mano de obra necesaria para cultivar maíz, frijol  y maicillo. El préstamo mejorara su vida, ya que cultivara a tiempo el producto y, en su calidad de vida en que tendrá una mejor producción y podrá tener la alimentación segura y a tiempo para su familia,  la necesidad a satisfacer será la siembra a tiempo de sus productos de granos básicos. 

Su sueño, para su familia es que tengan una vida en donde no les falte nada, y puedan desarrollarse bien y logren lo que se proponen. Para su negocio, es que cada año  pueda cultivar para tener la alimentación segura e instalar su propio puesto de venta  de granos básicos y ampliar su negocio sembrando más terreno del  que actualmente cultiva.
texts.en:
Josefina is 45 years old and studied up until the second grade of primary school. The father of her children left her 12 years ago, but she has been in a relationship for 3 years and her current partner is a farmer just like her. There are four people living in her house: her 18 year old son who works in agriculture, her 6 year old grandson who studies, and her and her life partner.   

Josefina has been a farmer for 38 years, a job her father taught her how to do. She also has another source of income selling cakes and prepared fruit. Her workplace is four blocks from her home which she can walk to or sometimes go by cart. Her life partner is the person who helps her on the farm.

The loan she is applying for will be put towards the purchase of seeds, fertiliser, herbicides and workers to grow corn, beans and sorghum. The loan will improve her quality of life as she will be able to harvest her crops in time, obtain a better crop and have a stable food supply and time for her family. Her main task will be to plant seeds at the same time as her basic grain crops. 

Josefina's dream for her family is to have a life where they don't want for anything and where they can grow and prosper and achieve all they put their mind to. For her business, her dream is that each year she can grow enough to have a stable food supply, set up her own kiosk of basic grains and expand her business by sowing more seeds than what she is currently growing.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, herbicides and pay the workers to cultivate corn, beans and sorghum.

loans.name: Karina Rosmery

texts.es:
Karina de 19 años de edad, es casada y esta esperando su primer hijo, ya tiene 6 meses de embarazo, ella se caso hace 7 meses en la comunidad. Estudio hasta segundo grado del nivel básico, se traslado hasta la comunidad donde reside hoy en día, y por la distancia ya no siguió con los estudios.

Su esposo trabaja en la albañilería, y sale a trabajar a otros municipios, regresa a casa los fines de semana. Con el esfuerzo de ambos han podido construir su propia casa. 

 Karina, se dedica desde hace trece años a la elaboración de hamacas (seda y poliseda),  aprendió gracias a su madre que se dedica al negocio de la elaboración y venta de hamacas desde hace mas de 25 años.
Ella le ayudaba a la mamá y fue así como se fue incursionando en el negocio. También gracias a su esfuerzo y esmero ahora  también han comprado un molino nixtamal para moler el maíz a las personas de la comunidad, lo cual le genera otros ingresos económicos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es  para comprar una caja de hilo de seda la cual trae 100 lbs y tiene un costo de $450.00  el resto del dinero lo necesita para la compra de los manguillos para elaborar las hamacas. Con la inversión, espera  mayor producción de hamacas, lo que incrementaran las ganancias para el sostén de la familia.

 Ella vende las hamacas en la ciudad, cada 15 días, en ocasiones le ayuda a vender las hamacas su madre quien siempre trabaja con ella. Desea, continuar trabajando fuerte, para crecer a su futuro hijo y con el tiempo mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Karina, 19, is married and is expecting her first child. She is six months pregnant and got married seven months ago in the community. She went to school though second grade of primary school. She moved to the community where she lives now and because of the distance, she couldn't finish school.

Her husband works in construction. He goes to other towns to work and then returns on the weekends. With both of their efforts, they were able to build their own home.

Karina has been making silk and poly-silk hammocks for thirteen years. She learned from her mother, who has done this work for 25 years. She helped her mom and this is how she started her business. Also, because of their care and efforts, they have been able to buy milled nixtamal to grind corn for the people in the community, which will generate additional income.

She is requesting this loan to buy a 100 lb. box of silk thread that costs $450.00. The rest of the money will be used to buy hammock handles to make hammocks. With this investment, she hopes to increase hammock production. The earnings from this will help to support her family.

She sells hammocks in the city every 15 days. On occasion, her mom helps her sell the hammocks. She hopes to continue working hard to raise her future child and improve her home over time.

loans.use: to buy a 100 lb. box of silk thread that costs $450.00. The rest of the money will be used to buy hammock handles to make hammocks.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Pha is a 30-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is still in school while the other is too young. Pha is a rice farmer and she and her husband cultivate a five-hectare plot of land. Together, she and her husband can earn about 23,000 KHR each day to provide for their family’s needs. Pha has been with VisionFund for two cycles and has completely repaid her previous loans.

Pha is the leader of a group requesting a loan. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline needed on her farm. In the future, Pha hopes to make more rice to earn a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and gasoline needed on her farm

loans.name: Saray's Group

texts.en:
Saray is 26 years old and lives with her husband in a rural village of the Moung Russey district. Rice farming and corn planting are the main sources of income for her family and she has been in these businesses for five years. The current business earns her about 20,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

This is the fifth loan for Saray with VisionFund. With her successful past loan, she has been able to provide her family with sufficient food. She is now leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to improve her house and also hopes to have a decent house in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Sreylak

texts.en:
Sreylak is 42 years old and lives in a rural village of the Dambae district. She has four children, three of whom are dependents and still in school. She has been earning a living through planting and growing cassava while her husband is a solider in the village. The current business earns her about 25,000 KHR per day. 

This is a micro-loan for Sreylak and she is a sixth-cycle client. The past loans that she completely repaid have helped her relieve her financial burdens and have improved her livelihood. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to increase her current business to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: El Esfuerzo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal El Esfuerzo está conformado por diez integrantes, siete mujeres y tres hombres,  madres y padres responsables con quince hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables con ganas de superación personal, en sus ratos libre les gustas disfrutar de la compañia de su familia y les preparan platos típicos de la región como “ quesillos” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco comunal  El Esfuerzo es Justina y tiene por actividad económica la crianza y venta de cerdos en pie. Actividad que la desempeña es su casa de habitación y dedica unas ocho horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y  comprar un lote de cerdos para la crianza y venta, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua, para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "El Esfuerzo" communal bank is made up of ten members - seven women and three men, all of whom are responsible parents with a total of fifteen children in their care.  They are all originally from Malpaisillo, in the north of the country, and can be characterised as hard-workers, responsible and with a desire to overcome any obstacles.  In their spare time the members of the communal bank like to enjoy the company of their families and they prepare typical meals from the region for them.  These dishes include "quesillo", a fresh cheese dish.  Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, the members were not able to study and, from a young age were forced to work in order to support their respective household's costs.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Justina is the coördinator of the "El Esfuerzo" communal bank.  She makes a living raising and selling live pigs.  Justina does this work from her home, working for around eight hours every day.  The objective for this loan is to invest in working capital and to buy some pigs to raise and sell.  She is doing this so that, in the not-too-distant future, she can earn a higher income.  The communal bank is grateful for the help Kiva investors are providing to people with few resources and to poor countries, such as Nicaraugue, so that people can have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and stock up her business raising and selling pigs.

loans.name: Jacson

texts.en:
Jacson is 37 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past four years, Jacson has been working hard to manage his small business which sells bags.

To help expand his business, Jacson has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more bags to sell, which will help Jacson generate greater profits and buy other needs for his family. Jacson hopes that in the future, he will be able to increase in stock. 

Jacson is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jacson who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more bags to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 42 years old and a widow with four children, two of whom are in school.

Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of household goods like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from buying and selling charcoal.

Evelyn aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of household goods like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Lorena Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lorena, se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un nuevo préstamo porque requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio de venta de ropa; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar ropa para damas y caballeros, asimismo productos de belleza.  
Cuenta el crédito anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus ingresos y obtener  mayor inventario; es por ello que las condiciones económicas y las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
texts.en:
Lorena is in need of a new loan because she needs more working capital in order to continue with her business selling clothes.  This investment will allow her to buy clothes for men and women, as well as beauty products.

Lorena's previous loan helped her to increase her income and to buy more stock.  As a result her and her family's circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy clothes for men and women, as well as beauty products.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: Maria es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Tiene 57 años de edad. Casada, madre de 4 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante y se dedica a la venta de accesorio para damas, hace 34 años. En este negocio la apoya uno de sus hijos y tiene como otra fuente de ingresos dinero que le envía su hija desde panamá. Realiza sus ventas en una pequeña tienda dentro de su casa. Le gustaría dar a conocer su producto en el Departamento de Jinotega, ya que es una zona donde sus productos se venden al por mayor. Su expectativa es aumentar sus ventas con el fin de adquirir mayores ingresos. Solicita el crédito para comprar aretes, cadenas, pulseras, anillos, entre otros con el fin de abastecer a su clientela. Estima que el crédito será de mucha ayuda  para comprar  mercadería que tiene encargada. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura del local, con el fin de brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes. Su meta próxima es viajar a panamá y comprar productos que pueda vender en Nicaragua.
texts.en: María is originally from the city of Managua.  She is 57 years old, married, and a mother to four children.  She is a businesswoman and makes a living selling accessories for women.  She has been doing this work for 34 years and receives support from one of her children.  Her daughter, who lives in Panamá also sends money to support her.  María makes her sales in a small shop that she runs out of her house.  María would like her products to be known in the Jinotega department as it is an area where they are sold in bulk.  María expects to increase increase her sales and, thus, increase her income.  She is applying for a loan to buy earrings, necklaces, bracelets, rings, creams, perfumes, and more in order to stock up for her customers.  She believes that this loan will be of great help as she buys the merchandise.  María's future plan is to improve her premises so that she can offer quality service to her customers.  Her next goal is to travel to Panamá to buy products that she can sell in Nicaragua.

loans.use: to buy earrings, necklaces, bracelets, rings, creams, perfumes, and more.

loans.name: Jingle

texts.en:
Jingle aspires to make his furniture building business grow and become stable until he grows old with his wife. He is a 34-year-old father of two young children. He has been engaged in furniture construction for 15 years already. Having this business has allowed Jingle to invest in a house, a farm lot, and a motorcycle. 

He is asking for a loan to further expand his business by buying wood, machines like a plainer, and other tools for making furniture. He hopes that his monthly income of 20,000 PHP will increase so that he can put it towards investing in his children's education in the future.

loans.use: to buy wood, machines like a plainer, and other tools for making furniture.

loans.name: Matilda

texts.en:
Matilda is applying for a loan of $1,200 from TRM (Tuba Rai Metin). She is 38 years old and married. She runs a kiosk in front of her house and she will use the loan to buy stock to keep in her store. This stock includes soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), alcoholic drinks (beer), cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, eggs, noodles, water, slippers, fish, biscuits, and rice. She is making good money from selling goods and she wants to apply for a larger loan in the future. 

Matilda is living in a town nearby the school. Her kiosk is located in a strategic place where many people come to buy goods, including students. She has a very simple house because her husband was a farmer and had animals such as horses, buffaloes, and chickens.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks (Fanta, Coca Cola, Sprite, Sagiko), alcoholic drinks (beer), cigarettes, sugar, coffee, salt, eggs, noodles, water, and slippers

loans.name: Sagrado Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es:
El Sagrado Corazón de Jesús está conformado por once mujeres, madres solteras con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarias de Telica, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar  y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a sus esfuerzos y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora del banco comunal es Yelba y  tiene por actividad  económica la crianza  y venta de cerdos en pie. La actividad la desempeña en su casa habitación, y dedica unas ocho horas diarias. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y comprar un lote de cerdos en pie, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Sagrado Corazón de Jesús agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Sagrado Corazón de Jesús" communal bank is made up of eleven single mothers, with a total of twenty children in their care. They are all originally from Telica, in the west of the country, and can be characterised as hard-workers, responsible and with a desire to overcome any obstacles. Unfortunately, due to a lack of money, the members were not able to study and, from a young age were forced to work in order to support their respective household's costs.

Thanks to her efforts and her desire to get ahead, Yelba is the coördinator of the communal bank. She makes a living raising and selling live pigs.  Yelba does this work from her home, working for around eight hours every day. The objective for this loan is to invest in working capital and to buy some live pigs to raise and sell. She is doing this so that, in the not-too-distant future, she can earn a higher income. The "Sagrado Corazón de Jesús" communal bank is grateful for the help Kiva investors are providing to people with few resources and to poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that people can have a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Rusudan

texts.en:
Rusudan is 24 years old and married. She lives with her husband in Kutaisi, Georgia’s second-largest city.  Rusudan’s husband is a minibus driver and transports people, in return for a service fee.  Rusudan is a hair stylist, and she serves her customers in her house. She has been in this business for a year and has many loyal customers.

Her business is going well. That’s why she’s decided to develop it and start a beauty salon, where she could serve her customers comfortably and attract others, as well.  With the startup loan, Rusudan wants to rent the salon space and purchase all the needed modern inventory to begin a hair care business. According to her estimates, the business will be profitable and will increase the income for her family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the same business, and the newlywed couple will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs. Rusudan awaits your support.

loans.use: to start up a beauty salon

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 42-year-old married woman who lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running an enterprise in which he provides a facility for embroidery work. He has been recruiting the workers for embroidery work on daily wages, including those who sit in the front of his shop and call the customers for embroidery. He also brings some material home for his wife because she helps him in the embroidery work. He is very much an expert in his profession. He is especially famous for bridal dresses. People like him for his art and appreciate for his efforts. 

Now, the marriages season is going on and there is a lot of demand for his art. He wants to cope with the demand of bridal dresses, which is why he wants to buy stock of thread, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors in advance.

Her husband requires some capital to buy desired inventory but he has already been investing all of his savings in his current business. So, she made a  humble request to BRAC Pakistan for a loan. Through this loan, her husband will be able to buy stocks of thread, fancy cloths, sequins, and pearls of various colors.

Now, her husband is free of tension about the stock and puts his full concentration in his work. Nasreen is very glad and thankful to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a variety of thread, sequins, pearls, etc. for embroidery.

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en:
Dexter resides in Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental with his family. He has two children. He earns a living from his motor transportation services. 

Dexter successfully repaid his previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which he used to repair his motor. Now, he borrowed a loan again in the amount of 15,000 PHP to cover the hospitalization costs of his family dependent. 

He is hopeful to find ways to augment their living and be able to build their own house for his family

loans.use: to cover hospitalization costs.

loans.name: Tatevik

texts.en:
Tatevik lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Her family consists of her parents and brother. She and her parents are currently working, but they cannot even take care of their family's basic needs because of their low salaries. The difficult socioeconomic conditions have forced Tatevik's brother to migrate to Russia as a labor migrant, to try to help his family from abroad. Unfortunately, even the latter does not fully meet the family's costs. 

To be able to live on, Tatevik and her family breed a livestock of cows and hens. They now need to buy some forage for the livestock to be able to nourish them. A loan of 1,000 USD will be a great support to the family and will assist them in purchasing forage for the livestock. Tatevik and her family will be very thankful to lenders for support.

loans.use: to buy some forage for livestock

loans.name: Carola Anahi

texts.en:
Carola dreams of working in international business but, without a degree, knows it may never be possible. Carola is currently attending the Instituto de Comercio Exterior y Aduanas working towards her degree in business. She plans on graduating in September 2014 but, without a loan from Vittana, she thinks that she may need to take time off to work and save until she can return to school.

Carola plans on using her loan to buy her school books. Up until now, she has been managing to get by without them, but it has become a challenge. With books and school supplies, she feels she will be able to get better grades.

Carola currently works 25 hours a week. One of her biggest challenges has been making time to work and go to school. With a career in business, she expects to earn $30 a day – a substantial increase from before. With one older sibling already attending college, Carola is unsure how she would be able to afford her tuition fees on her own without the assistance of a Vittana loan.

loans.use: to pay for her school books

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer to support his studying.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard is married with three children, and they live in a five bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam division of the North West Region of Cameroon. 

He has faced so many challenges in life, among which are inadequate finance to manage his business, death of family members, sickness in his family, and marital problems.

He has taken, and successfully repaid, his loans twice, and says with this new loan requested, he will open a poultry farm where he will rear chicks, expand his piggery farm and add more materials like planks, nails in his carpentry workshop. 

He has a positive view of his business succeeding because he has undergone training in poultry and pig rearing, and he has been operating this carpentry workshop for many years. With this business activity, he will supply chicks and piglets to the community at lower rates. They will be used for ceremonial activities.

With the profit from this business, he will cater for his children's basic needs, provide three square meals to his family, and make provision for his family's health care. He prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates.

loans.use: to open a poultry farm, expand his piggery farm, and add materials to his carpentry workshop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her education in Accounting at Thanh Do University

loans.name: Nana

texts.en:
Nana is 37 years old from the small town of Khashuri. She is widowed and has two children. The younger daughter is underage and gets a small  orphanage pension from the local government. 

Nana works at the local hotel as an administrator. Her wage is approximately $120 per month.
