As the existing funds are not enough to satisfy their needs, Nana and her children decided to restart a trading business that was stopped due to the financial problems. 

With the received loan, they will go to capital city open market and purchase apparels and household items, such as blankets, linens, etc. to resell them to their community members. 

Nana hopes that the business will be lucrative and increase her turnover gradually. She will develop the business with the support of her children, and generate income to improve the living conditions for them.

loans.use: to restart a trading business in clothing, apparels, and household items.

loans.name: Mafia

texts.en:
Mafia is a kind 25-year-old young woman. She is married and has a son. Her husband is very hardworking and loves his family very much. He is involved in his own business to earn a regular income for his family. He is involved in manufacturing and selling furniture such as single beds, tables, etc. He started this business over 10 years ago. Mafia's husband had previously obtained loans for his business, and is requesting a 2nd loan to increase his selection of furniture. 

Today, he has many regular customers and also takes orders from other cities. This business yields a good income for him, but his family's needs are increasing day-by-day and he needs to earn more money. Now he wants to buy more raw materials for making furniture in order to expand his business. Therefore, Mafia came to BRAC Pakistan and wishes to obtain a loan to buy raw materials for marking furniture. Mafia hopes that this loan will prove beneficial and productive for her husband's business as well as for her family. Mafia says thanks to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy raw material for making furniture.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
Doña María Concepción es ama de casa y agricultora con una edad de 56 años con un grado de educación cursado hasta el sexto grado de la primaria. Ella es madre de 8 hijos de los cuales solo dependen tres y están estudiando una carrera en la secundaria además dependen de ella cuatro nietos de sus dos hijas mayores. Ella se dedica al cultivo de café en mediana escala, maíz y frijoles aunque solo para consumo de su hogar ya que se ha dedicado a estas actividades desde hace muchos años y es el único medio para obtener ingresos para su hogar. Sus cultivos están ubicados una pequeña fracción alrededor de su casa y la mayor parte a 5 minutos de distancia caminando en la cual se involucran todos los miembros de su hogar.

Doña María Concepción tiene el sueño que sus tres hijas menores se gradúen y tengan un título que les ayude a defenderse en la vida ya que para dejarles un patrimonio tienen que luchar mucho y consideran que ya no tienen fuerzas para trabajar la tierra. Por lo que hoy en día han solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL 5 QQ de urea, 5 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 5 QQ de fórmula 18-26-0 con lo que asistirá sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
María Concepción is a housewife and farmer.  She’s 56-years-old and completed sixth grade in primary school.  She’s the mother of 8 children but only three of them are still dependent on her and attending secondary school.  Four grandchildren from her two oldest daughters also depend on her.  

She works as a medium-scale coffee grower and grows, corn and beans for family consumption.  She’s been doing this work for many years and is her only source of household income.  A small portion of her fields is located around her house and the greater part of them is a five minute walk away; all the family members take part in the chores.

María Concepción’s dream is that her three youngest daughters graduate and obtain their degrees so that they will be able to fend for themselves in life and to leave them a legacy; they must strive much and feel that they don’t have the strength necessary to work the land any more.  

She has requested a loan today from Comixmul cooperative to buy five quintals of urea, 5 quintals of formula 12-24-12 and five quintals of formula 118-26-0 to provide care for her coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Haijar

texts.en: Haijar was born in 1977. She is married and a mother of five. She lives in a part of Jordan called Dair Alla. Her husband is a government employee and a driver. Haijar has been raising and selling livestock since two years ago. She started with a small number of livestock. Then she raised their number, as she found her project profitable. With the profits she can improve her family’s living conditions, in addition to covering her children's needs. Now, she needs to raise the number of her livestock further. But she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more livestock to trade

loans.name: Jose Onecifor

texts.es:
José, vive con su familia. El, se dedica a la venta de zapatos y ropa usada, es por ello que se le presenta la necesidad de optar por un  préstamo, ya que requiere de más capital de trabajo para continuar en su negocio; esta inversión le ayudara a comprar ropa y zapatos usados, asimismo billetes de lotería.
Su sueño es a aumentar la clientela y sus ventas para ofrecerle a sus hijos  una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
José lives with his family. He sells used shoes and clothes, for which reason he needs to opt for a loan, as he needs more working capital to continue with his business. 

This investment will help him buy used clothes and shoes, as well as lottery tickets. 

His dream is to increase his customer base and his sales in order to offer his children better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy used clothes and shoes, as well as lottery tickets.

loans.name: Ignatius

texts.en:
Ignatius is 34 years old and lives in the town of Kasese in the Fortportal region of Uganda. He is married and has 3 children with 2 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years Ignatius has been working hard to manage his pub, which sells soda, beers, wine and spirits. 

To help expand his business, Ignatius has requested a loan of 2.500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve the business and buy more soda, beers, wine and spirits to sell. These sales will help Ignatius to generate greater profits and help the family in meeting their needs. Ignatius  hopes that in the future he will be able to increase his inventory. 

Ignatius is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ignatius who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to improve the business and buy more soda, beers, wine and spirits to sell.

loans.name: De Confianza Los Cerritos Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal de Confianza los Cerritos está conformado por once mujeres y un hombre madres y padres responsables con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de  Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona central  del país. Estas personas se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libres disfrutan de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar y  se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas María es la coordinadora del banco comunal y tiene por actividad una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, jabón, café, jugos. Ella dedica unas 12 horas diarias a su negocio, el objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal de confianza los cerritos agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Confianza los Cerritos is made up of eleven women and one man, responsible parents with 20 children in their care. They are from Malpaisillo in the central part of the country. These people are known for being hard-working, responsible, and with great drive to succeed. In their spare time they enjoy the company of their children. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, they weren't able to study and had to work from an early age.

Thanks to her endeavour and ambition, María is the coordinator of the communal bank and her business is a "pulpería" located in her home. A pulpería is a small store which sells basic goods in small quantities, such as rice, beans, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, soap, coffee, and juices. She works 12 hours a day in her store. 

The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her store so that in the not-so-distant future she will able to improve her income. The communal bank Confianza los Cerritos is grateful for the help offered by the Kiva lenders to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy groceries

loans.name: Luz De Campo Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Luz de Campo está conformado por doce integrantes, once mujeres y un hombre, madres  y padre soltero con  veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Se caracterizan por ser personas trabajadoras, responsables con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar en familia en actividades recreativas dentro de sus posibilidades. Lamentablemente no pudieron estudiar  una carrera, y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, Nubia es la coordinadora del banco comunal y tiene por actividad económica la venta de artesanías propias de la región como. Floreros de barro, jarrones, casa de barro, mascaras, muñecas, casa de barro, adornos de cocinas, sol, estrellas, canastas de barros gigantonas de barros. Actividad que la desempeña  de forma ambulante y  en su casa de habitación. El objetivo es invertir en capital de trabajo  y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de artesanía, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El banco comunal Luz de Campo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The “Luz de Campo” (Light of the Countryside) communal bank consists of 12 members, 11 women and one man.  They are single mothers and father with 20 children in their care.  They are from León, a place located in the western part of the country.  They are noted for being hardworking, responsible people who want to improve personally.  In their free time they enjoy spending time with their families in recreational activities that are within their possibilities.  Sadly, they were unable to study careers and were obliged to start working at a very young age to help with household expenses.

Thanks to her effort and drive to get ahead, Nubia is the communal bank coordinator and her economic activity is selling crafts that are typical of the region like clay vases, jugs, clay houses, masks, dolls, kitchen decorations, suns, stars, clay baskets and giant clay figures.  She carries out this activity from place to place and at home.  Her objective is to invest in working capital and stock up her crafts buying and selling business so that in the not too distant future her income will improve.  

The Luz de Campo communal bank is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua so that they can have an honorable way to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy crafts.

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en:
Romeo is engaged in operating a motorcycle transport business, and he delivers charcoal for sale, as a second business. He is now 51 years old. He is a father of two, both of whom graduated from college, and his wife is working as a domestic helper in Cyprus. Romeo lives in the simple village of Caliat, with his children and grandchildren.  

Romeo feels great that through working for years in his businesses, he has managed to support his family, especially the education of his children. He is earning PHP 2,000 income from transport and charcoal sales every week. He has been using this income in the business to grow further, for the family's daily needs at home, and to put away savings for future emergencies. 

Romeo is now asking for financial assistance. He will use it to buy charcoal and to repair and maintain his motorcycle, which he uses for providing transport services and making charcoal deliveries.

loans.use: to buy charcoal and to repair and maintain his motorcycle, which he uses for providing transport services and making charcoal deliveries

loans.name: Janine

texts.en:
Janine is married and has two children, and the family resides at Lapasan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Her husband is earning an extra income by providing barber shop services, while Janine operates their own farm. She plants and harvests bananas to sell, to earn a living. She's been in this business for over five years.

In 2012 Janine joined GDMPC, to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid her previous loan, which made her farm improve. Now she needs to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for her banana farm. Without hesitation, she  requests a loan of 15,000 PHP; she expects to gain an abundant harvest, in return. In the future, Janine wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, such as manure, for her banana farm

loans.name: Efrena

texts.en:
Efren has run a sari sari store for many years specializing in fruits to resell to earn a living. She lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental along with her family. Her husband helps her run the business. 

She has been a member of Gata Daku MPC since 2008 and has successfully repaid her previous loans that have been used for business improvements. She is thankful to GDMPC that through its services, she was able to handle her business properly. Recently, she borrowed another loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase a variety of fruits to resell. 

Her revenue was used to support the studies of her children and with this passion, she never get tired of doing this business. All she wants to see is her children's success in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of fruits to resell.

loans.name: Khadra

texts.en: Khadra was born in 1953. She is widowed and a mother of 5 children. Khadra is trying her best to support her children. She has been baking a special type of Arab bread called “Shrak”. She's also made pickles for the past 5 years. She found it a profitable project. She needs to buy ingredients to raise her productivity and income. To do so, she applied for this loan as she doesn't have enough money to buy them.

loans.use: to buy the needed ingredients to make pickles in order to trade them.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is engaged in selling fish sauce in their village. In order to expand the business, she is asking for a loan to buy a volume of fish sauce all the way from Pangasinan, a place famous for delicious "bagoong" (fish sauce). She has been doing the business for thirteen years now. She is earning a net income of PHP 1,000 weekly from selling the fish sauce and uses it to provide school allowances for her children. 

She is now 49 years old, widowed, with eight children, two of whom are currently studying. She hopes to continue to support the studies of her children so they will able to use it in the search for better job opportunities.

loans.use: to buy a volume of fish sauce all the way from Pangasinan.

loans.name: Jeronima Francisca

texts.es:
Jerónima Francisca, casada originaria de León, lugar que está ubicado e n  la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de su familia y le prepara platos típicos de la región como es “indio viejo”  lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar u una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Por lo tanto lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.

Gracia a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica la venta de productos comestibles una pulpería, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, fósforos, jugos, huevos, cuajadas, gaseosas, tiste. El cual está ubicado en su casa de habitación. Ella dedica a su negocio  unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Jerónima Francisca agrade la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jerónima Francisca’s married and from León, a place located in the western part of the country.   She’s noted for being a hardworking, responsible woman who very much wants to improve personally.  She enjoys spending time with her family in her free time and preparing traditional regional dishes like ‘Indio Viejo.’  Sadly, because of the lack of economic resources she was unable to study a career and had to start working at a young age to help with household expenses.  Therefore, she works hard every day to provide a better future for her children.

Thanks to her effort and drive to get ahead, her economic activity is selling grocery items in a ‘pulpería’ which is a small store that sell items like rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, matches, eggs, curd, soft-drinks, cornmeal and chocolate powder in small amounts.  It’s located at her house.   She spends about 12 hours daily at work selling her goods very happily.  

The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock her store to buy and sell goods so that in the not too distant future she’ll be able to earn higher income.  Jerónima Francisca is grateful for the help Kiva lenders provide to people of scarce resources and to poor countries like Nicaragua to have an honorable way to earn a living.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio raises rice crops within his locality. He lives with his wife and six children. Antonio is now 53 years old but is still full of hope in life. Three of his children are still studying and in need of enough sustenance. Antonio also hires laborers who help him plant and harvest rice to sell. They usually sell harvested rice to traders and earn about 30,000 PHP each harvest season (twice a year). Antonio would like a loan of 50,000 PHP that will allow him to buy fertilizers, insecticides, pesticides, and help him pay farm labor costs.

Antonio hopes to become a successful farmer and keep his farming business a viable source of income for his family. In this way, he could support his children's education expenses and give them a comfortable lifestyle someday.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, insecticides, pesticides, and cover labor costs in his farming business

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Norma works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from food vending.

Norma is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use it to buy items to sell at her store, like shampoo, soap, milk, sugar, and canned goods.

Norma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream - to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like soap, milk, and canned goods

loans.name: Mathayel

texts.en:
Mathayel was born in 1970. She is married and a mother of three. Mathayel works in agriculture and, at the same time, she sells blankets since one year ago.

Mathayel wants to help her husband to improve their living conditions. To do so, she decided to add selling clothes to her project, in order to raise her income. But currently she doesn't have enough money to buy clothes to trade. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and blankets to trade

loans.name: Rasha

texts.en: Rasha was born in 1991. She is married and has 2 daughters. She lives in a rented house in a sector in Jordan called Madaba. Rasha has been working in selling cosmetic products and accessories for 3 years. She started her project at home and found it to be good support for her husband in covering their children's needs as he is a driver and his work is a weak source of income. Now she has decided to open a beauty salon and she needs furniture in order to start decorating it. But she doesn’t have enough money to buy furniture. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: To buy furniture for her beauty salon

loans.name: Yusra

texts.en: Yusra was born in 1963. She is married and has a son. Her husband works at a private company. Yusra has been selling chickens for one year. She has found this to be a good support for her husband and son. Now she is seeking to buy a larger quantity of chickens in order to trade them and increase her profits. But she doesn't have enough money for that. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to buy more chickens to trade.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en: Samira was born in 1988. She is married and a mother of two. Her husband is in the military. Samira has been selling housewares for one year. She started her business at home, then she opened her own store. Her business was profitable and a good support for her husband and children. Samira is planning to expand her business by getting a larger quantity of housewares and other products to sell. But she doesn't have enough money to buy them. For this reason, she applied for this youth loan.

loans.use: to obtain more housewares and other products for her store.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel de 53 años de edad, casado, originario de León, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país, se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. 
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una  panadería donde ofrece topo tipo  de pan como pan dulce, simple, cachos, picos, tortas de piñas, pasteles, queques. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos de panadería como harina, huevos, levaduras, moldes, aceite, especies. El dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo sus productos, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Daniel agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Daniel is 53 years old, married, and comes from Leon which is located in the western part of the country. He is known for being a hard-working and responsible man with a great desire to succeed. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources, he wasn't able to pursue a university degree, instead he had to work from an early age in order to help out with the household expenses. 

Thanks to his endeavour and his desire to get ahead, he runs a bakery where he sells all kinds of bread, cakes, and pastries. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and to stock his business with baking products such as flour, eggs, leaven, molds, oil, and condiments. 

He works 12 hours a day selling his products, so that in the not-so-distant future he may be able to improve his income. Daniel is grateful to the Kiva lenders for offering people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua a decent means of work.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to buy bread, cakes, and pastries

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is married, 53 years old, and resides in Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental along with her family. Her husband is a farmer and she helps to  operates their farmland, planting and harvesting corn for sale to earn a living. Emma has successfully repaid her previous loan from Gata Daku MPC, which was used to acquire farm inputs. Now she requests a loan of 5,000 PHP to cover the weeding costs of her farm.  In the future, Emma wants to make improvements to her house and to improve her family's general living conditions.

loans.use: to cover the weeding costs of her farm.

loans.name: María Deysi

texts.es:
María de 53 años de edad, una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora, un ejemplo a seguir. Actualmente vive sola aunque, están viviendo sus 2 hijas como vecinas a su casa, y pasan mayor tiempo con ella ayudando en los oficios del hogar. 
Se dedica a la elaboración de pan, desde hace 5 años, siendo las quesadillas su fuerte, además, vende otro tipo de bocadillos como yuca frita, plátanos fritos y chicharras. Ella comercializa sus productos en la comunidad y algunos clientes le van a comprar hasta su casa.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar mas materia prima para la elaboración de pan, con esto tendrá mas clientes, porque abastecerá mas la demanda y tendrá muchos mas ingresos. Su sueño es tener una venta mas fuerte, y tener empleados haciendo pan.
texts.en:
María, 53, is an enterprising, hardworking woman; an example to follow.  She currently lives alone although her two daughters are her neighbors and spend most of their time with her helping with household chores.

She worked baking bread for the last five years.  Cheese bread is her specialty.  She also sells other types of snacks like fried manioc, fried bananas and fried pork skin.  She sells her goods in the community and some of her customers come by her house to buy.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy more bread baking raw materials in order to have more customers because she’ll be able to supply more demand and earn much more income.  Her dream is to increase sales and to hire employees to bake bread.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Juana Antonia

texts.es:
Juana, vive con sus hijos de 25 y 30 años de edad. Ella, se dedica a la venta de comida y ropa, dichas actividades las realiza desde hace varios años atrás y todos los días sale a vender con sus hijos al tiangue.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar mercadería necesaria, tales como: maíz, arroz, frijoles, aceite, pollo, carnes, asimismo ropa para damas y caballeros; esta inversión le ayudara al fortalecimiento del negocio y crecer aun mas en el.
Su sueño es ayudar a sus nietos a que estudien, ya que por el momento no lo están haciendo.
texts.en:
Juana lives with her children who are 25 and 30 years of age.  She works selling food and clothes.  She’s done these activities for many years now and goes out to sell with her children in the street markets every day.

The loan she’s requesting will allow her to buy necessary merchandise like corn, rice, beans, oil, chicken and meats as well as clothes for women and men.  This investment will help her strengthen the business and grow even more in it.  Her dream is to help with her grandchildren’s schooling because at the moment they aren’t in school.

loans.use: to buy corn, rice, beans, oil, chicken, meats as well as clothes for women and men.

loans.name: Jose Carlos

texts.es:
José, vive en casa propia junto con su esposa. Ella, posee una venta de gas propano y granos básicos, dicha actividad la realiza desde hace dos años y lo desempeña de 8:00am a 6:00pm, atiende cliente de sus alrededores y lo lleva a cabo solo aunque piensa expandirse; ventaja que no posee competencia.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar variedad de mercadería, tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, condimentos, sal, entre otros y gas propano; esta inversión será de mucha ayuda, ya que por el momento los granos básicos están con bajos precios y también el gas para revenderlo.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y tener personas para atender a los clientes.
texts.en: José lives in his own home with his wife. He runs a business selling propane gas and basic grains, which he has done now for two years. He works in this business from 8:00am to 6:00pm and attends to customers from the surrounding areas. He currently runs his business alone but plans to expand because he has the advantage of not having competition. He needs the loan to allow him to buy a variety of goods including rice, beans, sugar, condiments, salt and propane gas. This investment will be of great help because basic grains and gas are currently at low prices. His dream is to expand his business and have personnel to attend to his customers.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, condiments, salt, propane gas and other items.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en: As a married parent of six children, Noemi works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable buying and selling business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from farming rice and buying and selling charcoal. Noemi is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional vegetables to sell. Noemi  has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business in order to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Linet

texts.en: Linet lives in the Likoni area of Kenya. She is 42 years old and married with one child. She owns a retail shop that she has been running for the last eight years. The business has been doing fine. She has employed someone to help her run the business. She knew Milango through an employee and now she seeks a loan to buy building materials for building her house. Her business challenges include price fluctuations. The extra income that she will raise will help her rent her apartment and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy building materials to build her house.

loans.name: Vanessa Graciela

texts.es:
Vanessa de 23 años de edad, una joven muy dedicada a la  buena atención de clientes, posee una tienda con  productos diversos, actualmente vive con su tía, su abuela, una hermano y su hija de 5 años de edad que esta estudiando kinder en la escuela.
Su abuela suya, fue quien comenzó a invertir en la tienda hace ya 15 años; pero actualmente la administradora y es dueña Vanessa, quien tiene mucho tiempo de ayudar a su abuela con las ventas y ahora quiere invertir un poco mas en la tienda.
El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más producto para la tienda. Mejorando sus ingresos y también pueda cubrir la demanda de los clientes potenciales que posee.
Su sueño es que su hija se supere en el estudio y pueda sacar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Vanessa, 23, is a young woman who is very dedicated to good customer service.  She owns a general store and currently lives with her aunt, her brother and her 5-year-old daughter who is attending Kindergarten at school.

Her grandmother was who started investing in the store 15 years ago but Vanessa is the current owner and manager.  She’s helped her grandmother with sales for a long time and now wants to invest a little more in the store.

The loan she’s requesting is to buy more goods for the store improving her income and to meet demand from potential customers she has.  Her dream is that her daughter does well in her studies and is able to complete a university career.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for the store.

loans.name: Nargis' Group

texts.en:
Nargis is 32 years old, married, and the mother of three children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Nargis has applied for a loan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. 

Nargis is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: maintain her husband's rickshaw.

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en: Crisanta, 56 years of age, is married and blessed with three children. She has managed a vegetable vending business for almost eight years, and she travels around her village with her bicycle to sell vegetables. From this she's earning a net income of 500 PHP a day. Crisanta also sells raw meat, fish and chicken for additional income. Due to inadequate capital, she has applied for a loan amounting to 25,000 PHP to purchase eggplants, root crops, squash and variety of vegetables to sell. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can continue to improve her business to become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase eggplants, root crops, squash and a variety of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: José León

texts.es:
José de 66 años de edad, se ha dedicado  a la agricultura toda su vida, por lo que no le fue posible ir a la escuela  en su niñez.  Aprendió a leer  y escribir en el transcurso  de su vida adulta. Vive con su compañera de vida y 2 hijos de la señora que aún asisten a la escuela, la compañera de vida, se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos  y cuidar a los niños. 

Por su parte, José se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, desde muy corta edad; actividad que la aprendió de su padre, a demás de esta actividad se dedica a la crianza de cerdos  y comercializarlos ya que la agricultura  no le genera los ingresos suficientes para salir a delante con todos los gastos. 

 El préstamo será utilizado  para comprar 3 litros de pesticidas, 2 sacos de abono y 2 litros de foliar para la siembra de frijol, con la compra de estos insumos se solventara la necesidad de mantenimiento del cultivo de frijol  y tendrá la oportunidad  de obtener  una mayo la cosecha.  

Los planes a futuro, son ampliar  el área productiva  con el fin de tener mas ingresos económicos  y así mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
José, 66, has worked in agriculture his entire life which kept him from attending school in his childhood.  He learned to read and write as an adult.  He lives with his life companion and two of her children who are still attending school.  His life companion works doing domestic chores and caring for the children.

On his part, José works growing basic grains.  He started at a very young age learning the activity from his father.  In addition, he also works raising pigs to sell because agriculture does not generate sufficient income to cover all his expenses.

The loan will be used to buy 3 liters of pesticide, 2 sacks of manure and 2 liters of leaf fertilizer for the bean crop.  The purchase of these supplies will meet a need he has for bean crop maintenance and he’ll be able to obtain a greater crop yield.

His future plan is to expand his productive area aiming at earning higher income thus improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Neba Eveline

texts.en:
Neba Eveline is married with two children and they live in a four bedroom apartment in Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are the death of family members like her father. Her mother is blind. She has inadequate capital to manage her business.

She has taken and successfully repaid her loans four times, and says with this new loan requested she will increase her business, buying more palm oil, groundnut oil, flour, sugar, yeast and firewood for resale. She has a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing it for so long, she has experience in the businesses, she has a good business site, and she has a good approach that encourages her customers to buy on a regular bases. With this business activity, the community will benefit from buying her products, such as the firewood, fried gateaux, palm oil, etc., at cheaper prices.

With the profit from this loan, she will pay her children's school fees, cater for the feeding of her family, provide medication to her family, pay her bills and also engage in farm work. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, palm oil, groundnuts, groundnut oil, and firewood.

loans.name: Jose Osmar

texts.es:
José, es una persona de hogar, vive con su madre y está acompañado. El, se dedica a la pesca artesanal y a la albañilería, dicha actividad la aprendió con su padre, ya que comenzó desde los 14 años la pesca y a los 18 años se dedico de lleno a la albañilería y ya tiene cerca de 20 años de desempeñar estos oficios.
El préstamo que solicita le permitirá comprar  hilo para tramoyo y unos tubos para colocar una fosa retoricas; esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar su hogar porque le hará alguna remodelación.
Su sueño es remodelar por completo su hogar, adquirir un equipo moderno de pesca y ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
José is a man of his home.  He lives with his mother and his spouse.  He works as an artisanal fisherman and as a construction worker.  He learned said activity from his father since he started fishing at the age of 14 and at the age of 18 started working in construction full-time.  He’s now been doing these jobs for about 20 years.

The loan he’s requesting is to buy mesh for a net and some tubing to build a pit.  This investment will help him improve his home because he’ll do some remodeling.  His dream is to completely remodel his home, to acquire modern fishing equipment and to offer his family better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy mesh and pipes.

loans.name: Rodalyn

texts.en:
Rodalyn is 34 years old and married with three children.

Rodalyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, chips, etc.

Rodalyn has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from meat-vending and direct-selling.

Rodalyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, canned goods, eggs, chips, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crafts making supplies.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. 

Fifteen years ago she decided to start a stitching school business at her home to meet her household expenditures. She is expert in stitching fine clothes, so she decided to teach her arts to the girls of her area. In this way she is enabled to get more income and spread her arts to others. She teaches and stitches, with the help of her students, for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

Due to lack of funds, however, she is unable to teach each of her students because she does not have more stitching machines for practice. She contacted BRAC Pakistan for a loan so that she could get an additional machine to help her students practice. It’s her third year with BRAC Pakistan and she has shown good repayment behavior. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy a stitching machine for her tailoring school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh fish for resale and inventory for selling pupusas.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña María del Carmen es una señora casada con una edad de 41 años de edad ama de casa y agricultora con un grado de educación de primaria completo. En compañía se dedican a la agricultura hace muchos años con el cual tiene 4 hijos, el mayor tiene 22 años quien está en la universidad cursando una licenciatura, el segundo tiene 20 años y estudio mecánica industrial, la tercera tiene 17 años curso hasta el primer año de computación y no siguió por razones personales y la menor que tiene 15 años está en primero de carrera, con ellos vive una nieta que es hija de la tercer hija. Ella se ha dedicado a la agricultura por generaciones específicamente al cultivo de café, pero también cultivan maíz y frijoles solo para el consumo de su hogar. La tierra que tienen fue adquirida poco a poco gracias a sus esfuerzos la cual está ubicada aproximadamente a 5 minutos en carro la cual es forma para trasladarse de ellos en familia. El producto lo venden por medio de intermediarios que llegan hasta la comunidad para comprarlo siendo en este momento su desafío recuperar una pequeña fracción de sus cultivos la cual esta cultivada de café que fue perjudicadas por la roya.

Doña María del Carmen sueña con hacer crecer su negocio y lograr que sus hijos lleguen a estudiar una carrera universitaria preparándose académicamente de una mejor manera. Su meta es poder dar asistencia el más pronto posible a sus cultivos de café una parte para recuperarla de la roya y la otra para protegerla por lo que hoy en día ha solicitado un financiamiento a la cooperativa COMIXMUL para comprar urea, fungicida, plaguicida, abono 12-24-12, formula cafetalera 18-26-0 con lo que podrá asistir sus cultivos de café.
texts.en:
María del Carmen, 41, is a married housewife and farmer; she completed primary school.  She and her spouse have worked in agriculture for many years.  They have four children.  The oldest is 22-years-old and attending university in a Bachelor’s Degree program.  The second one is 20-years-old and studied industrial mechanics, the third one is 17-years-old and she completed the first year of computer science but due to personal reasons did not continue and the youngest who is 15-years-old is in the first year of the career.  A granddaughter who is daughter of her third daughter also lives with her.

She’s worked in agriculture, specifically growing coffee, for generations but they also grow corn and beans for home consumption.  The land they have was acquired little by little thanks to their efforts and it’s located about a five minute car drive away which is the way the family gets to it.  They sell what they grow by means of middlemen that come to the community to acquire it and their challenge at that moment is to recuperate a small portion of their crop that was not damaged by the La Roya [fungus].

María del Carmen dreams with making her business grow and that her children study university careers preparing themselves academically the best way possible.  Her goal is to provide coffee crop assistance as soon as possible in order partly to recuperate it from the La Roya and partly to protect it.  This is why she’s asking Comixmul cooperative for a loan to buy urea, fungicide, pesticide, 12-24-12 manure and coffee formula 18-26-0 to assist her coffee crop.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee crop.

loans.name: Groupe Scolaire Faraja

texts.fr: Le client Baeni est leader du collectif d’affaire des enseignants du « groupe scolaire Faraja», doyen, âgé de 64 ans et père de 9 enfants qui étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs foyers. Son épouse est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires  et les divers. Le client est confortable de son apostolat d'enseignant, bien que le salaire ne soit pas satisfaisant pour réaliser des grands investissements. Le nouveau prêt  va lui servir  dans son projet d’habitat  et d’acheter un nouvel équipement de sa maison (chaises, armoire, appareils électroménagers, etc.).  Ainsi, elle souhaite renouveler son prêt prochainement et lancer le projet  de construction de maison  pour ses locataires.   Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux enseignants.
texts.en:
Baeni is the Dean and leader of a teacher's collective called "Group Scolaire Faraja". He is a 64-year-old father of nine children, some of whom are in school and some of whom already have their own homes. His wife sells foodstuffs and miscellaneous products.

Baeni is comfortable with his teaching job, but his salary is insufficient to make large investments. This new loan will help him with his housing project and allow him to purchase new furniture and equipment for his home (chairs, wardrobe, appliances, etc.). Afterward, he would like to renew his loan and start a housing construction project for his tenants. He strongly thanks Hekima for its support and micro-lending to teachers.

loans.use: to develop his housing project and purchase new furniture and equipment for his home.

loans.name: Shirley

texts.es:
Shirley es casada y vive con su familia en un departamento en alquiler en la ciudad de La Paz. Es profesora en dos diferentes colegios y su esposo es policia, trabajan mas de ocho horas al día porque sus sueldos no les alcanzan para cubrir todos los gastos de la casa incluído el alquiler. Es por eso que requieren el crédito, para poder acceder a un anticrético que ayudaría a no tener que pagar mas alquileres.

El sueño de Shirley es poder ahorrar lo suficiente con su esposo y poder darle una casa propia a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Shirley is married and living with her family in a rented flat in the city of La Paz.  She is a teacher in two different schools and her husband is a police officer.  Both work more than eight hours every day because their earnings are not enough to cover all household costs, including the rent.  So, Shirley needs this loan to pay a deposit which will help her not have to pay more rent.

Shirley's dream is to be able to save enough with her husband and be able to give their children their own house.

loans.use: to pay a deposit.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es viuda y vive con su hija en la ciudad de La Paz. Trabaja como comerciante por mas de 8 horas al día, su hija también trabaja y las dos hacen todo lo posible para poder cubrir los gastos mensuales de su hogar.

El crédito lo necesita para un tratamiento de salud ya que Martha debe hacerse operar de unos quistes encontrados en su cuerpo y al no tener seguro médico les resulta un poco costosa la operación.

El sueño de Martha es poder recuperarse y ahorrar el suficiente dinero para abrir un negocio propio y mas rentable.
texts.en:
Martha’s a widow living with her daughter in the city of La Paz.  She’s worked as a merchant for more than 8 hours daily.  Her daughter works too and they do everything possible to be able to cover their home’s monthly expenses.

The loan is needed for medical treatment because Martha has to have some cysts that were discovered in her body removed and since she has no medical insurance the operation is a bit expensive.

Martha’s dream is to be able to recover and save enough money to open a more profitable business of her own.

loans.use: to pay for surgery.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is an Egyptian Albanian who is literally poor and you can tell the level of her poverty from the picture. Like Esmeralda, there are so many other members of her community living under the same extremely poor conditions. Unfortunately, many of them die at a very early age and many kids were born with various types of disabilities due to the lack of nutrition and poor living.

Esmeralda is a 30-year-old married mother of two children, 14 and 5, with the oldest one going to school. They live in a city. She is requesting lenders' generosity to help her install doors to her one-room family home with this loan, because the winter will start soon. This will be the second loan, with the previous one being paid off.

loans.use: to install a door to their one-room family home for four

loans.name: Riman Group

texts.en:
This group is called Riman. It consists of four ladies who live in Hodeidah, Yemen.  They have many clients, mostly women.

Riman is 42 years old. She is the coordinator of her group.  She is a divorced woman. She has been selling fried food for seven years. She started selling in her business when she divorced her husband. Riman's most important challenges are to work hard to gain extra income and to improve her business structure.

She is receiving a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to buy food materials like flour, salt, yeast and baking soda for her business. In the future, she would like to expand her business to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food materials like flour, salt, yeast and baking soda for her business

loans.name: Miriam Josefa

texts.es: Doña Miriam es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Tiene 48 años de edad. Casada, madre de 4 hijos, es de oficio comerciante y se dedica al negocio de pulpería hace un año. Ella comenzó vendiendo zapatos y sandalias de manera ambulante por los barrios de la capital, poco a poco junto al apoyo de su familia ha salido adelante y logro establecer su propio negocio en su casa. Solicita el crédito para comprar: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, gaseosas, jugos, golosinas, papel higiénico, pasta dental, jabón, ropa y zapatos, con el fin de abastecer a sus clientes  y aumentar sus ingresos.  Estima que el crédito será de éxito para su pulpería y  nivel de vida, ya que podrá adquirir más clientela a través de la variedad de productos que oferta. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en:
Miriam comes from the city of Managua. She is 48 years old. Married and a mother to four children, she is a shopkeeper by trade and a year ago she started working in the general store business. 

She began by selling shoes and sandals without a fixed place of business, traveling to different parts of the capital. Little by little, with the help of her family, she has moved up and managed to establish her own business out of her house.

She is requesting the loan to buy rice, beans, sugar, soft drinks, juices, candy, toilet paper, toothpaste, soap, clothes, and shoes, with the goal of accommodating her clients and increasing her earnings. 

She believes that the loan will be a success for her store and her quality of life, as she will be able to attract more customers through the variety of the products she sells. Her future plan is to improve the infrastructure of her house.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, soft drinks, juices, candy, toilet paper, toothpaste, soap, clothes, and shoes.

loans.name: Juana Inocente

texts.es:
Juana de 39 años de edad,  solo estudio 2° grado , su esposo trabaja prestando servicios como militar, solo tiene un hijo y vive con ella ,el cual va a la escuela a 6°grado y aparte de él, vive la mamá de ella con ellos. Actualmente, solo realiza los oficios domésticos en su casa, antes trabajaba como empleada en una pupuseria.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para cancelar deuda que adquirió por la enfermedad de su mamá.
Su deseo, es  hacer una casa nueva, y comprar un carro para hacer viajes a personas hacia los cantones cercanos, o instalar  un negocio, con un crédito grande
texts.en:
Juana is 39 years old and only studied the second grade in school. Her husband is serving in the military, and she has only one child, who lives with her. He goes to school and is in the sixth grade. Aside from him, Juana's mother also lives with them.

At present, she only does domestic work in her house, though she used to work at a 'pupusería' (shop that makes and sells 'pupusas,' Salvadoran filled tortillas).

She is requesting the loan in order to pay off debt that she took on due to her mother's illness. 

Her wish is to build a new house, and buy a car for transporting people to nearby cantons, or to start a business, with a large loan.

loans.use: to pay off debt she took on due to her mother's illness.

loans.name: La Joie Group

texts.fr: La cliente Barakagira est conseillère d’une association d’affaire  «La joie»,  jeune entrepreneur expérimentée, âgée de 38 ans  et mère de 7 enfants qui étudient tous. La cliente est vendeuse de braises. Son conjoint est un chômeur, toute fois, il peut occasionnellement réaliser de petites commissions issues de ventes de parcelles, aux quelles, il a faciliter les transactions.  Elle installe ses marchandises  à son domicile. Elle commença ses affaires avec  son fonds propre reçu de son mari, il y a plus de 8 ans.  La cliente a déjà réalisé beaucoup de micro projets à travers les bénéfices de ce commerce. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir d’acheter 3 sacs de braises. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son activité et construire une jolie maison pour ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour son soutien en microcrédit aux petits entrepreneurs non bancables. Il sied de signaler qu'une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en: Our client Barakigara is the leader of the La Joie [Joy] business group. She is an experienced young entrepreneur. She is 38 years old and has seven children, all of whom are in school. She sells charcoal. Her husband is unemployed, even though occasionally he makes a commission on sales of land plots that he facilitates. Barakigara sells out of her home. She has launched her business with her own funds received from her husband over eight years ago. She has already completed many microprojects thanks to the revenues from this business. This new loan will allow her to buy three bags of charcoal. She would like to grow her business and build a nice house for her children. Finally, she cordially thanks Hekima for its microloan support provided to small entrepreneurs who do not have access to traditional banking. It should be noted that one of the clients is carrying her child in her arms.

loans.use: to buy three bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy building supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Lizbeth Paola

texts.es:
LIZBETH PAOLA ES UNA JOVEN ESUDIANTE, DE 27 AÑOS DE EDAD SOLTERA Y ESGRESADA DE LA UNIVERSIDAD.
ELLA ESTUDIO LA CARRERA DE DERECHO Y CIENCIA POLITICAS, Y ELLA ,YA SE ENCUENTRA TRABAJANDO COMO ASISTENTE EN EL JUZGADO DE ESTA LOCALIDAD.
ELLA SE ESTA MUY ORGULLOSA Y ENTUSIASMADA POR HABER CONCLUIDO SUS ESTUDIOS QUE DURO 6 AÑOS DE MANERA SATISFACTORIA, Y TIENE MUY CONTENTOS A SUS PADRES.
ELLA ESTUDIO PARA SER ABOGADA POR LA VOCACIÓN DE SERVICIO QUE SIEMPRE A TENIDO.
LIZBETH ESTÁ MUY AGRADECIDA POR LA FACILIDAD Y DICE : "GRACIAS A TODAS LAS PERSONAS QUE AYUDAN A LOS JOVENES A CUMPLIR SUS METAS Y SUEÑOS"
texts.en:
Lizbeth Paola is 27 years old, single and a university graduate. She studied a career in law and political science, and is now working as an assistant for the court of this district. Lizbeth is very excited and proud to have satisfactorily finished her studies, which lasted six years. She says she has made her parents very happy. Lizbeth says she studied to become a lawyer because it has always been a profession dedicated to serving others.

Lizabeth is very grateful for the opportunity she had, and she says “thank you to all the people who help young people to reach their goals and realize their dreams.”

loans.use: to pay the remaining fees for her bachelor’s degree.

loans.name: Carminda

texts.es: Doña Carminda, tiene 48 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos con quienes vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Doña Carminda siempre se ha dedicado al comercio, lleva 5 años de vender mercadería como ser, ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, , sandalias, carteras, cortinas etc. vende de manera ambulante y en su casa. Para tener activo el negocio ha invertido varios prestamos, actualmente ha solicitado el ciclo numero 8 y es por un monto de 21,000 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar blusas, jeans, camisas y zapatos para vender, con el fin de mantener variedad de productos que ofrecer. Ella tiene planes de mantener el negocio de donde pueda obtener los ingresos necesarios para la manutención y estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en: Carminda, 48, is single mother of four children living with her in the municipality of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.  Carminda has always worked in commerce.  She’s been selling merchandise like women’s, men’s, children’s clothes, sandals, purses, curtains, etc. for five years.  She sells from place to place and also from home.  To keep her business active she’s invested several loans into it and is currently requesting her 8th for 21,000 Lempiras to buy blouses, jeans, shirts and shoes to sell aiming at having a wide variety of goods to sell on-hand.  She plans to stay in business to earn the income needed to support and school her children.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes to sell.

loans.name: Shahnaz

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a 35-year-old married woman from Lahore, Pakistan. She lives in a tiny house with her husband and 4 children. 

Her husband had been doing a job in a clothing firm with a low income which was not enough to cover the family's needs, so he opened a small restaurant in the city three years ago. It is a good business and earns enough money for his family, but he would like to improve it by expanding the space and buying more tables and chairs. 

Shahnaz took a loan from BRAC Pakistan to accomplish the improvements. Using this loan, her husband will be able to develop his business so his income will be increased.

loans.use: to buy chairs, table and crockery for restaurant

loans.name: Drande

texts.en:
Drande is 57 and still grieving after one of her sons died in a car accident. “I will be grieving forever. It’s been very painful for me to go over all the images of that accident and the memories of his kindness towards me. This is the watch that he gave me for my birthday before his fatal accident, and I wear the watch all the time,” Drande said, showing the watch and wiping away her tears with her white headscarf. Her uniform represents a grieving one in her region.

Drande has only one grownup child at the moment. For thirteen years, she has been selling milk and baby calves to the locals and with this loan she wants to build a stable for the animals.

loans.use: to build a stable for the animals

loans.name: Barbare Charlotte

texts.fr: Charlotte est une femme de 56 ans veuve, mère de 6 enfants dont l'age varie entre 9 et et 24 ans. Trois de ses enfants vont encore à l'école. elle est commerçante dans un marché de la place où elle vend des vivres frais et secs selon les saisons et aussi des poissons fumés et harengs depuis 6 ans déjà. cette activité fonctionne à merveille c'est pour celà qu'elle sollicite ce crédit pour augmenter son stock de plantains en achetant un pick de plantain ceci pour augmenter ses ventes et son bénéfice, d'éviter les ruptures de stocks qu'elle rencontre souvent. Profit qui l'aidera à économiser pour la scolarité de ses ses trois enfants et de ses deux petits fils et de subvenir aux besoins quotidien de sa famille.
texts.en:
Charlotte is a 56-year-old woman, a widow, and a mother of six children ranging from nine to 24 years of age. Three of her children still go to school. She is a vendor at a local market, where she has been selling fresh and dried foodstuffs in season and also smoked fish and herrings for six years

This business is going very well, so this is why she is requesting this loan to increase her stock of plantains, to increase her sales volume and her profit, avoiding stock shortages she often faces.  The revenue will help Charlotte to save money for the education of her three children   and that of her two grandchildren, as well as to provide for everyday needs of her family.

loans.use: to stock up on plantains.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Doña Francisca es una mujer de 57 años de edad, casada y muy luchadora con un grado de escolaridad de primaria incompleta cursada hasta el 3 grado. Ella es madre de 3 hijos y día a día se esfuerza para tener un mejor bienestar para ella y su familia. Ella se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas como ser: tomate y zanahoria ya que dicha experiencia la adquirió en compañía de su esposo hace más de 15 años y también se dedica a la venta de comida. El terreno que ella y su esposo tienen es propio ya que lo adquirió por medio de sus padres gracias a una herencia que ellos mismos le obsequiaron. Su producto es comercializado y vendido por los compradores que llegan a la zona y demás que viven alrededor de su casa de hogar. Ella y su familia se esfuerzan y trabajan duro para poder tener una mejor calidad y estilo de vida.

Actualmente Doña Francisca solicita ayuda para poder invertir en la compra de semilla certificada de zanahoria y abono para poder sembrar y cultivar ya que así ella podrá mejorar sus cultivos y sembrar una mayor cantidad.
Su meta es poder tener una producción de provecho que le genere lo estimado para poder seguir cultivando y poder cumplir sus sueños de formar un capital propio para poder seguir invirtiendo en su cultivo ya que de esa manera ella podrá estar re invirtiendo en sus cultivos y mejorando cada día el patrimonio para sus hijos.
texts.en:
Francisca’s a 57-year-old married woman.  She’s very hardworking and only completed third grade in elementary school.  She’s mother of three children and she strives daily to provide better well-being for her and her family.  

She works growing vegetables like tomatoes and carrots having acquired this experience more than 15 years ago from her husband; she also sells food.  The land she and her husband work is their own since they got it from their parents thanks to an inheritance they passed down to them.  They sell their products to buyers that come by the zone and to people living nearby.  She and her family strive and work hard to have better quality of life and better lifestyle.

Currently, Francisca is asking for help to be able to buy certified carrot seeds and manure to be able to plant and cultivate because she’ll be able to improve her crops this way and to plant in larger amounts.

Her goal is to be able to have a good crop yield that will generate what she’s calculated to be able to continue growing and reach her dream of amassing capital of her own to continue investing in crops to continue thus reinvesting in her crops and improving her children’s estate more every day.

loans.use: to buy certified carrot seeds and manure.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie lives in the town of Kasese in the Fort Portal region of Uganda. She is single and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past ten years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her boutique, which Sells clothes . 

To help expand her business, Winnie  has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve the business and buy new clothes to sell. This will help Winnie generate greater profits, which will assist her in buying necessities for the family. Winnie hopes that in the future she will be able to increment in stock. 

Winnie is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Winnie who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to improve the business and buy new clothes to sell

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is 38 years old, a married woman and mother of five children. Her husband is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. 

For this reason, Zahida has applied for a loan for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for the vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide a better transport service to his passengers. Zahida is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: To pay for body maintenance on the rickshaw.

loans.name: Maria Aida

texts.es:
Doña María tiene 54 años de edad con un grado de educación primaria no completado ya que ella solo pudo cursar el primer grado por los diferentes problemas económicos que en su familia se presentaban ya que eran de escasos recursos. Su esposo también tiene un grado de educación primaria no completado cursado hasta el quinto grado con el que procreo 2 hijos. El primer hijo tiene 32 años y vive en otro país el cual les ayuda con remesas y el segundo llego hasta tercer grado ya que no le gusto el estudio y decidió trabajar la tierra igual que sus padres. Sus ingresos económicos dependen del cultivo de café aunque también tiene una pequeña pulpería que le genera más ingresos para su familia. En familia elaboran las diferentes actividades como limpieza, corte, poda, aplicación de fertilizantes, abono, etc. que ayudan al mantenimiento del mismo. La tierra que trabajan es propia la cual heredaron a doña María sus padres y la otra parte la han comprado con el fruto de las primeras cosechas de café las cuales están ubicadas a unos 15 minutos en carro.

Doña María tiene como meta y propósito asistir sus cultivos de café y sembrar una nueva plantilla para agrandar sus cultivos ya que la economía de su familia depende mucho de este rubro y con los resultados de la producción hacer una terraza en la parte de atrás de su casa para que una vez el grano este cortado y lavado pueda tener un espacio en el cual pueda secarle. Por los que hoy en día ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el cual comprara 3 QQ de urea, 6000 unidades de plantilla de café, 3 QQ de fórmula 12-24-12 y 3 QQ de fórmula 18-24-0.
texts.en:
María is 54 years old.  She was only able to study up to first grade and did not finish primary school because her family had various financial problems and they were poor.   Her husband didn’t complete primary school either as he only studied until fifth grade.  They have two children.  Their eldest son is 32 and lives in another country and he helps them with expenses.  The younger son completed third grade but he didn’t like school, so he decided to work the land like his parents. Their income is dependent on coffee cultivation, although they also have a small general store that generates additional family income.  The family engages in various activities such as cleaning, cutting, pruning, and applying fertilizer and manure, which helps them maintain their crops.  They own the land that they work.   They inherited some land from Maria’s parents, and with the profits from the first coffee harvest, they bought another parcel.  Their crops are a fifteen minute drive from their home.

María’s goal and purpose is to tend to her coffee crops and sow new coffee plants to expand her crops because her family is very dependent on this work.  With the income from the production, she plans to make a terrace in the back of her house so that once the beans are cut and washed, she will have a space in which to dry them.  For this reason, today she has requested a loan from the Comixmul cooperative, with which she will purchase 3 quintals of urea, 6000 units of coffee plants, 3 quintals of 12-24-12 formula, and 3 quintals of 18-24-0 formula [types of fertilizers].

loans.use: to purchase new coffee plants, and purchase inputs to maintain the planted crops.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy lives in the Likoni area in Kenya. She is 29 years old, married and has one child. Her child goes to school and is three years old. For the last three years she has been running a clothing business that has been growing. She is looking forward to adding stock of second-hand clothes, mostly targeting children aged four to twelve years. 

Nancy knew of Milango through a friend, and she decided to join. She sees her business expanding in the next five years, and she hopes she will be able to open her own shop where she will sell these clothes. The challenge for her is that when customer demand is high, she doesn't have enough stock to serve them all. The extra income that she will raise will help educate her son and give him a better future.

loans.use: to buy stock of second-hand clothes

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es: Sonia Maribel de treinta y seis años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia. Ella se dedica a los servicios domésticos, lavado y planchado, además su esposo es jornalero, trabaja todos los días en el campo para completar gastos; Sonia es una mujer activa, dedicada a su labor y muy responsable, su vivienda es muy humilde y está ubicada en una zona rural debido a sus escasos recursos, necesita hacerle unos arreglos a su hogar, quiere encementar todo el suelo pues así se mantendrá un poco más limpio y es más saludable para sus hijos porque no estarán muy expuestos al polvo, quiere empezar el trabajo lo más pronto posible, pero no posee de suficiente capital por eso le solita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar materiales, arena, grava y cemento. Sonia Maribel está muy alegre que le brinden ayuda, y se compromete a efectuar todos los pagos hasta cancelar la deuda.
texts.en:
Sonia Maribel is 36 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in their own home. She works doing domestic chores such as washing clothes and ironing. Her husband is a day laborer who works every day in the fields to help with expenses.

Sonia is an energetic and responsible person who is very dedicated to her work. She says that her home is very modest and is located in a rural area because she has limited resources. She would like to make a few improvements to her home such as covering the dirt floor with cement. She says this will make her home a little easier to keep clean, and that it will be healthier for her children because they will be exposed to less dust.  Sonia would like to start the job as soon as possible, but she does not yet have enough money.

Sonia is requesting this loan from Kiva and the field partner to buy sand, gravel and cement to improve the floor of her home. Sonia Maribel is very happy to have the help, and she says she promises to make all of the payments until the loan is repaid.

loans.use: to buy sand, gravel and cement to improve the floor of her home.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman, with five children, all in school. She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mary operates a food-making business, making foods like beans and chapati ( flat bread) in a cafe. She sells her food to passersby and neighbors. 

With the KSH 20,000 she wants to purchase more food items, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and of establishing a restaurant in the near future.

loans.use: to buy food items, such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Ashawanja

texts.en:
Ashawanja is 57 years old and married, the mother of five children. 

For the past 15 years, she has earned a living by selling charcoal in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. 

Ashawanja is applying for her fourth loan. This loan of KES 50,000 will help her purchase additional sacks of charcoal needed for her business. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for her children, as well as to continue expanding her business. 

Ashawanja's goal for the future is to own a well-established charcoal distribution depot in the area, so as to help improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of charcoal  for her business

loans.name: Reina Morena

texts.es: Reina Morena de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida de cuarenta y dos años, su hijo y su madre en casa propia. Ella es empleada de un comedor pero su sueldo no le alcanza para cubrir gastos, por eso recibe la ayuda de su esposo que es enfermero y además su hijo se dedica a la agricultura; Reina es una mujer muy entregada a lo que hace, se siente orgullosa de tener una familia muy unida por eso trata de darles lo mejor, desde hace algunas semanas se decidió a colocar en la puerta principal, una puerta de hierro con balcón porque eso le dará mas seguridad a los miembros de la casa, pero no posee de capital suficiente que respalde los gastos por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar la puerta de hierro y además pagar la instalación. Reina Morena está muy contenta con ayuda.
texts.en:
Reina Morena, 43, lives with her 42-year-old life companion, their son and her mother in a house of her own.  She’s employed in an eatery but her salary is insufficient to cover expenses so she gets help from her husband who is a nurse and from her son who works in agriculture.

Reina is a woman who is very devoted to what she does.  She feels proud to have a very united family which is why she wants to give them the best.  

A few weeks ago she decided to install an iron gate with a balcony in her main entrance at home to provide more security to her family members but she does not have sufficient capital to do so which is why she’s asking FUSAI for a loan that will make it possible for her to buy the iron gate and also to pay for its installation.  Reina Morena is very happy with the help.

loans.use: to buy a metal gate and pay for its installation.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma operates a clothes selling business. She sells in a shop to her town dwellers, passersby and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the 50,000 KES, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Aida Group

texts.en:
The Aida group consists of four females from Hodeidah, Yemen. Aida, 40 years old, is a married woman who is responsible for nine children. She works hard to assist her husband in providing for the family. 

Aida has started her job creating homemade henna items, like mixing perfumes and creams which are used by brides for their wedding. She sells it to retailers, customers and door to door. 

Any shortages of her product items will cause her job to stop. That is why she has applied for a loan to buy the required henna items to continue her business. All members of the group are hoping to earn a good income, which will allow them to improve their families' quality of life.

loans.use: to buy the required henna items to continue forward with her business.

loans.name: Mrike

texts.en:
Mrike’s husband passed away 18 years ago when she was 30. She was left with four children to look after, with the youngest one being only a couple of months old.

Here it is what Mrike said to the loan officer:

“My world changed in one instant, and I did not know how to stand up on my feet again. At first, I could not believe it, yet afterwards I accepted it but I was left with no strengths to deal with it. I remember it like it was today. We lived in a village and we were poor. My parents and siblings helped me to come out of that entire situation and I would not be here today without them. I left the village and went to another district with my children to build a new life there for them. So far, I have been doing well here these past fifteen years, running my livestock activity and selling dairy products and baby calves.”

Mrike now wants to make her animal stable more spacious with this loan.

loans.use: to build a spacious stable for her animals since she plans on expanding her livestock activity

loans.name: Winifred

texts.en:
She is married with three children and they all live in a three bedroom apartment in the Bamenda Mezam Division of the North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in life, among which are the deaths of her family members such her father, brother and other loved ones. Inadequate capital to effectively manage her business is the main problem in her family.

She has taken and successfully repaid a loan six times and says with the new loan requested, she will expand her business by buying more palm oil, good vegetables and groundnuts. She has a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing the business for a long time and has experience in the business. She has regular customers who buy her products. With this business activity, the community will benefit from the palm oil and good vegetables, and she will sell to them at low prices.

With the profit from this loan, she plans to educate her children and cater to the well-being of her family. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, groundnuts and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal roofing sheets.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a lady of 36 years, married, and the mother of four lovely children. 

She sells clothes and materials in Limuru, and she has been in this business for four years now.  She earns a monthly income of fifty thousand shillings.

This will be Mary's fourth loan from KADET LTD.  She plans to use the entire loan to buy materials for resale.  

In the future, she wants to have a happy family, employ more people, and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials for resale

loans.name: Ansila

texts.en:
Ansila is a 39-year-old woman and is married to Oskar, a 39-year-old man. They are blessed with 4 children: Septian, 15 years old and in the 1st grade of a vocational high school; Veron, 14 years old and in the 3rd grade of junior high school; Valentino, 12 years old and in the 1st grade of junior high school; and Natalia, 11 years old, in the 6th grade of elementary school.

Ansila’s husband is a driver for one company. To support her husband in meeting their daily needs, Ansila initiated a business selling kinds of soft drinks in her house. The business has been running since 4 months ago.

At the moment she has to pay education fees for 2 of her children, but due to a lack of money to do so, she requested an individual loan from TLM of 3,000,000 IDR. The loan will be spent on her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to pay children's school fees

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a very hard-working woman and the mother of two grown children.  She lives in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. 

Penina prepares goat meat and soup. She cites seasonality as her major business challenge.

With the KES 20,000, she wants to purchase goats for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to buy goats for her food business

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 45-year old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of two daughters and a son.
