Irshad requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband. Her husband is a shoemaker by profession; he has been making shoes from his childhood. This is the reason he has lot experience in his profession. He wants his elder son to also learn this art from him, but his son is not interested in this profession. He makes shoes by hand, and his handmade shoes are very famous in his hometown. Previously he only provided services to his clients for shoemaking, but now that he has gotten lot of market experience he wants to buy material for his own shoemaking, so that he can earn  better than he did earlier. 

Irshad wants to construct her house, provide better education to her children and better establish the business of her husband. 

Irshad is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy raw material for making shoes.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is single, with five children, and the family lives in a two-bedroom apartment in the Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced so many challenges in living, among which are the deaths of family members and other loved ones, early marriages in her family, sickness of relatives, and having to drop out of school, due to inadequate finances to pay for her education.

With this new loan, she will increase her business by buying more vegetables, such as tomatoes, green spices, onion, garlic, magi, and peppers.

She has a positive view of her business succeeding because she has been doing her business for so long. She has a good business site with regular customers who buy from her, and she also sells good quality products. With this business activity, the community will eat plenty of vegetables at cheaper prices, which will lead to good health.

With the profit from this business, she will pay her children's school fees and provide them with other school necessities; expand her business by reinvesting the profit, and also pay her bills. She prefers GHAPE loans because of low interest rates and convenient repayment intervals.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, green spices, onions, garlic, magi, and peppers

loans.name: Ana Irma

texts.es: Ana Irma de cuarenta y tres años de edad vive junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos en casa propia desde hace 19 años. Ella se dedica  la venta de pupusas y su esposo es mecánico, los dos trabajan unidos para poder mantener los gastos del hogar; Ana es una mujer luchadora y muy trabajadora, siempre está buscando buenas oportunidades que le ayuden a cumplir sus objetivos, vive en las afueras de la ciudad y desde hace algún tiempo quiere elaborar una cerca que le dé más seguridad, por sus bajos recursos económicos no puede costear el gasto por lo tanto no posee de suficiente capital que lo respalde por eso le solicita a FUSAI un crédito que le permita comprar ladrillos, cemento, polines, tela metálica, para así poder tener una vivienda más segura. Ana Irma se siente muy agradecida con la ayuda y se compromete a cancelar toda la deuda.
texts.en: Ana Irma is 43 years old.  She has lived in her own home with her life partner and their two children for nineteen years.  She sells “pupusas” [stuffed tortillas] and her husband is a mechanic; the two work together to meet household expenses.  Ana is a go-getter and a hard working woman, always seeking new opportunities to help her achieve her goals.  She lives on the outskirts of the city and for some time, she has wanted to install a fence to give her more security.  However, due to her limited income, she cannot afford the expense and so she doesn’t have enough money to pay for it.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan from Fusai that will allow her to purchase bricks, cement, posts, and wire mesh, which will enable her to have a more secure home.  Ana Irma is very grateful for the support and promises to repay the entire debt.

loans.use: to purchase bricks, cement, posts, and wire mesh.

loans.name: Cuauhtémoc Group

texts.es: VisionFund otorga créditos para mejorar los negocios de los clientes y así puedan obtener ganancias con los cuales puedan darles a sus hijos una mejor alimentación y calidad de vida. Erika es una mujer trabajadora y muy responsable en sus ventas; dice que tienen más de 6 años vendiendo perfumes originales tanto para dama como caballeros y niños. Ella pertenece a un grupo llamado "Cuauhtémoc", comenta que ella empezó a vender fragancias para poder ayudar a su casa con los gastos del hogar poco a poco se fue aclientando y después decidió vender perfumes originales los cuales compra en la ciudad de México en una distribuidora de perfumes, dice que hay veces que su familia se los mandan de Estados Unidos ya que allá se los dan un poco más económicos y así ella le puede ganar un poco mas, también platica que tiene su negocio dentro de un centro comercial en su población llamada Zitacuaro donde a diario abre y que le paga a una chica por cuidarle el negocio ya que ella sale a ofrecer sus perfumes y cobrar ya que vende a sus clientes en pagos para que no se les hagan pesado pagarle cada semana o cada quince días. Dice que con el tiempo ella se ha preocupado por brindarles a sus clientes un mejor servicio es por eso que ella se hizo un catalogo de perfumes originales para que ahí escojan sus clientes y les hagan pedidos. Ella está solicitando un crédito a VisionFund para hacer sus encargos pendientes ya que tienen varios pedidos por parte de sus clientes. Los demás integrantes del grupo se llaman Dulce María, Raquel, Zerafina, Yolanda, María Guadalupe, Irma María, Raúl, Consuelo, Armando y María Teresa ellos invertirán para sus negocios de compra y venta de pan, material para hacer lonas para negocios, para surtir ropa para dama, en helados para su venta, para la compra de frutas y legumbres, invertirá en una mercería, en juguetes, refaccionaria para autos, dulcería, calzado por catalogo y para surtir una tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
VisionFund grants loans to improve members’ businesses so that they can earn profits to provide their children with better nourishment and quality of life.

Erika’s a hardworking woman who is very responsible with her sales.  She says that she’s been selling original perfume for women, men and children for more than six years.  

She belongs to a group called “Cuauhtémoc” and she comments that she started selling fragrances to help with household expenses.  She acquired customers little by little and then decided to start selling original perfumes that she acquires from a perfume supplier in Mexico City.  She says that sometimes her family sends them to her from the United States because they are a little less expensive over there and she can earn a bit more.  

She also relates that her business is located inside a shopping center in her city of Zitácuaro where she’s open daily.  She pays a young lady to watch the shop while she goes out to sell her perfume and collect payment since she sells to her customers in installments so that it won’t be so burdensome for them to pay her every week or every fifteen days.  She says that in time she’s taken care to provide better service for her customers and this is why she created a catalog of original perfumes so her customers can choose from it and place orders.  She’s asking VisionFund for a loan to fill pending orders since she has several from customers.

The other group members are: Dulce María, Raquel, Zerafina, Yolanda, María Guadalupe, Irma María, Raúl, Consuelo, Armando and María Teresa.  They will all invest in their businesses such as buying and selling bread, materials to make tarps for businesses, to stock up on women’s clothes, to buy frozen treats to sell, to buy fruit and vegetables, to buy merchandise and toys, auto parts and candy, shoes by catalog and to stock a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy perfume.

loans.name: Kubran

texts.en:
Kubran is a 41-year-old married woman living with her family in Lahore, Pakistan.

Her son owns a sweet shop in her hometown. He sells different kinds of sweets.  She used to prepared all the sweets at her home with the help of her husband. Her husband used to run this sweet shop but due to his old age, now her son looks after all the matters. Her son purchases the sweets in large quantities from a nearby bakery and sells it from his shop.

Now he wants to offer additional different types of sweets to his customers but does not have a sufficient amount to buy these additional sweets. Therefore, Kubran requested a loan for her son so that he could buy his desired sweets to sell. Her son wants to prepare these sweets at home like his father had been doing so that he could get maximum income. He will make some savings with the profit amount and hopes in future he will prepare all the sweets by himself. 

Kubran says thanks to Kiva because they showed him a beam of hope to turn his business from backwardness.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making sweets to sell
